I was glad to see the farro risotto & budino were regular menu staples.   Every course was downright amazing & ended with the amazingness of the budino.  I was sold on the Liberty after Restaurant week, so we went back a few weeks later for a late date night.  The food was a notch below Restaurant Week, but still delicious.  and of course I had another budino.    They have really stepped it up with the pretzels, I am not joking when I say I would go for a beer, some pretzels & a budino & not be at all sad that I wasn't eating dinner.    My only gripe is how expensive the beer is, but they do have a good list & ever rotating taps & get in great obscure & rare beers that they notify their twitter followers about.

Probably been here half a dozen times and have always had enjoyable experiences. Highly recommend the American Crunch Burger -- pimento cheese, potato chips (on the burger, you get choice of a side), bacon, lettuce, and tomato -- absolutely delicious, albeit pretty pricey (15.95). The Bangers and Mash entree is also a favorite of mine. The bar has a  great list of craft beer as well, and the selection  goes well beyond Olde Meck and Noda Brewing, which are both fine, but can get old after being featured ubiquitously in Charlotte bars and restaurants.   As mentioned in previous reviews, parking is tight. Must be Tupelo Honey folks because this place is never crowded when I go. Went the Sunday before MLK day to catch an NFL playoff game and I was the only one in the restaurant OR bar area at 8:30pm -- so can't say it is has the most vibrant atmosphere.
Cool decor with amazing brunch. Great for families and couples. Spacious and inviting restaurant in South end. Great service. Our server Lindsey was super nice!
Sat at the bar.  They had a guy playing guitar and singing it was great.  Had the Crunch burger and hush puppies they both were yummy.  Will come here again

My husband and I both agreed that this was definitely not a do-over. The onion rings were factory made frozen from a box at 1$ a ring. The veggie burger was a bland blend of veggies. We sent the sweet potato fries back and the tater tots were not much better. I hate to give a bad review. However, this was a waste of hard earned money!
Went to the Liberty once. Stood at the door took forever for me to be acknowledged and then was told to find a seat.. Was not really impressed with the burger either.

tried this place out last weekend and it wasnt bad. I would give it 4 stars for the food. The burgers are good and the fries were great. But it was VERY pricey for what it was. I would have happily paid $8-$10 for the burgers we had, but one was 13 and the other was 16. And by no means were they the best burgers in town. Good food, but WAYYYYY overpriced.

Something always goes wrong whenever we go here.  We started going here because we heard they had poutine.  The first time we went we got poutine and buffalo brussel sprouts.  It was slow.  The Facebook page had said there would be an unlimited poutine special that night. The waitress didn't know what we were talking about so we ordered normal poutine.  It was fantastic.  Their gravy is amazing. They were generous with the cheese curds.  They brought us normal (not buffalo) Brussels sprouts.  We pointed this out and they said they would fix this.  They then brought us more Brussels sprouts. These also were not buffalo and were identical to the first.  We pointed it out again and they took these back and added the buffalo elements but this whole process probably took 45 minutes.  They still charged us for them and didn't offer any discounts or anything.  The next time we went we got poutine again but the cheese curds had Ben replaced by normal cheese.  It was still good though. We figured they were probably out of cheese curds but we wished they had given us a heads up.  The last time we went we ordered poutine and there was no cheese at all.  We asked about it and they said they could bring us some salad bar style shredded yellow cheese.  The waiter forgot that someone in our party ordered Brussel sprouts.  We had to ask him to refill our waters and service was slow despite the restaurant being empty. They also crammed us into a corner right next to the only other people in the restaurant.  They just keep messing up in really stupid ways.  If you have time to kill the food is good.

I used to love the Liberty, back when it first open it was the best burger in Charlotte. I admittedly turned a blind eye to its decline until my last experience.  Bragging about how good the burger was I forced to eat my words (and the food). It was more bun than burger and left a bad taste in my mouth. I am not sure I will be returning.  Read more at: http://eatitcharlotte.com/2016/09/15/the-liberty/

Yum! Perfect bar food, great beer selection, and fun atmosphere. I ordered the crunch burger, and I'm still dreaming of it.  Our table also ordered the pretzels, poutine, and calamari fries, and they were all gobbled up.

3.5 if you could. Great food, unique menu. Prices inline with the area being more uptown trendy in the south end district. Service was o.k. All burgers and sandwiches come with fries and any other option is an added price upgrade. Most beers around $6 so expect a couple of 2 with drinks and meal each to be around $50 with tip.

I visited the Liberty last week for the first day and was pleased. I wasn't sure as to what to expect from a "gastropub" so I went in with an empty stomach and my fingers crossed. We sat outside on the patio, which was perfect weather for a fall day but alot of noise with it being right off South Blvd. I noticed two things right off on the menu 1) Not alot of items (but I guess thats one of the aspects of a gastropub) and 2) Holy high prices batman! I was thinking about a burger but really wasn't feeling the whole $12/$13 for one.   I ended up getting the BBQ Pork Belly Sliders which were succulent and ok---out of this world. I think I was moaning with each bite and didn't want it to ever end. After seeing the french fries at our neighboring table, I got an order as well and they were disappointing. Limp=bad. Service was quick and attentive. All in all, I would head back here but definitely not the place to go if you are looking for huge portions or have something specific in my mind.

Had a great dinner that started with the sinful Poutine, continued with Short Ribs and ended with the Salted Caramel Budino. My husband had the Crunch Burger which he raved about. The food was great and our service was equally great. The only negative was the beers both my husband and I initially ordered were no longer available but this was not communicated to us upfront so there was a delay in being served our beer while the Poutine had already been brought to us.   It seems there is a breakdown in communication between the person who monitors the beer inventory to the server so that would be something to work on improving and why I was not able to give "5" stars.

This review is reflective of the service not the food. I went to the library to celebrate two friends birthday and it was a large group. The front end of my experience was good, the problem came in when it was time to pay the bill. I gave the server, Caitlin,  my debit card to close out my $23 bill and when I went to sign the receipt I saw that my card had been charged for $359!! Just as I noticed, the sever came running back and said "don't worry it did not go through" and took the billing envelope back (I assumed to correct my bill but she did not say nor did she apologize for the error). Naturally, I pulled up my bank account and sure enough it showed the $359 as "processing" which meant that my balance was immediately reduced and I did not have access to the funds. I tried to wait patiently but it had been several minutes and I had not seen Caitlin. I went to look for her and could not find her so I asked for a manger. I was assured by PM supervisor Alicia that the bill was not closed out (whatever that means) and this type of thing happens all the time (what???!) and whenever it does as long as it is not closed out the transaction falls off in the morning. I work in banking and that did not feel right to me. Typically it takes a couple of days for these types of things to fall off and $350 is not chump change. Everyone seemed so cool and calm, I guess because it wasn't their $350!! I asked about the procedure if it doesn't fall off as she said and she gave me the owner Matt's #. Sure enough, I pulled up my account the following day and the $350 charge is still there. I call the # provided for Matt and am told he is not in and that there was no one there that could help me. The best they could do was take down my # and they would be sure he got the message. No one could seem to tell when he would be in because he was "busy opening another location." Nice. The pub burger and fries I had was great but the sloppiness and lax attitude of the staff ruined an otherwise joyous occasion. We will see if Matt returns my call and does anything to make this right.   ***Update: I did not receive a call from Matt BUT I did call back until I got him. He asked questions to understand what happened, apologized and sent me a gift card to use toward my next meal. I am appreciative of the gesture. Updating to 4 stars."
Really enjoyed our dinner here! Sit outside if it's nice. Had the pretzels for a starter.   CRUNCH BURGER IS A MUST! Wow. Just wow.   MacNCheese is very fancy...not my preferred style but tasty.

Had lunch today for Mother's Day at The Liberty. First of all, when I made the reservation, no one mentioned that there would only be a 3 courses for $30 menu available, so when we got there and found out we were pretty disappointed. Second, the hostess said she would get us a high chair and then never returned, leaving my husband to get it for us. We ordered our 3 course meal around 1:30 and waited over 50 minutes for any food to arrive. Our waiter, Kendall, was very nice and attentive, but the food was ridiculously slow, and a manager never even came out to check on us or apologize. When the food did finally come out, I have to say it was very good, but we were so over it after waiting forever. We had to have the dessert boxed up so we could get out of there under 2 hours. Very disappointing.

I just gave this the 3 stars its averaged out to, with the caveat I haven't been there in about 6 months. I've been there about 3-4 times before that as I had a friend who worked there and went there to hang with her. In scanning the reviews on this place, the bad one always have a common element of bad service/surly servers/unknowledgibe servers, and I gotta admit that is my experience exactly...always been a fan of the food, but at best you get decent service; not great, not above & beyond...adequate is the best you can hope for...on the flip side you get the annoyed server, the server who has to go ask someone about every menu ? you have, the server who comes by your table about once an hour, etc......hey LIBERTY owners/managers, do you read these?...they come from a wide swath of people over a large period of time...there ARE good wait people out there, do u make an attempt to find any?...or weed out the bad ones once hired...I'd come back for the food but nothing else right now compels me to visit....

Ambiance- I sat at the bar and was very comfortable with the setting. The dining room looked above average with a clean simple design  Fare- I had the Chicken Sandwich and was very happy with it. The jalapeno bacon was a welcomed addition to the sandwich. A few of the menu items caught my eye and I will be returning to try them. Also, they have a fantastic beer and wine list.  Overall, if you have a hankering for high quality pub food at an affordable price, I recommend this place

I first ordered food from uber eats and the order was wrong. I called and the manager apologized and kindly wrote my name down to have my order replaced. I came back ordered my food to go. I Judy got to my destination and opened my food and my burger that was supposed to be medium well was burnt like I asked for WELL. Really reaaly sad cause the place has so many good reviews and I can tell the food is actually good when it's made the right way and not burnt.   People are really nice tho.

I came here for lunch with my family on a whim. My dad noticed they were open so we stopped in. The contemporary decor adds to the experience, we sat underneath the large coin painting, very cool! The bacon popcorn appetizer was interesting, but ultimately all the bacon fell to the bottom of the bowl and eating it with your fingers made a mess all over the table. I would suggest trying to make homemade kettle corn and add the bacon in last second so it sticks to the popcorn! I ordered the short rib poutine for my entree and it was fantastic, very rich and flavorful. Everyone was pleased with their burgers, the grilled cheese, and the fish n chips. Everyone at the table was raving about the Parmesan fries. Our experience was very positive and we will be back! Tip: ask about the Sautéed Baby.

I decided to give The Liberty another try since the first visit didn't go very well.  We went to try their burgers which have made several lists of the top burgers in Charlotte.  We arrived at 12:30 on a Sunday and were told it was a 10 minute wait.  Several tables left and were cleaned but we still waited.  The host came over and told us they were waiting to seat us to allow the wait staff to catch up.  We were then seated within the initial time frame. I ordered the pub burger with Parmesan fries. The fries were ok, nothing special.  My burger was ordered medium but was beyond well done. The tomatoes were red but not flavored like a good ripe tomato.  The burger was $14.  I don't see a reason to go back as there are far better burgers in Charlotte for less than that. Just not special!

We live nearby The Liberty and do our best to frequent often.  The food is great, with an ever changing menu.  However, it is always a running joke with us about how bad the service is.  It is SLOW.  We've been 8 times or more, and I can't tell you once where we've had good service.  However, we keep going back because the food is that good.  Their "lunchbox" special is always a great value.  Their burgers are generally very good, and we love their appetizers.  We will sometimes go to get apps and drinks there before heading out for dinner that night because they are so good.  The beer selection is good and changes as well.  All in all, it is a place worth trying, so long as you aren't in any particular hurry.
Amazing food, great service, perfect atmosphere.  I love the live music as well!  Always a treat to come here!

Was there on Mother's Day. Limited menu.  All the items looked great. The appetizer was really good. However 1:05 after being sat with a limited menu and not busy (1:30 post peak) we had no food. We left after paying 1/3 the set price. Drinks ran dry a few times as well. Bummer because the little we got was tasty.   Not sure how many reviews they need on service times to get it right. Hope they figure it out.
Great decor and fun place to go for dinner or lunch. I was in Montreal last fall and discovered poutine and the liberty has this dish and does it well!

The food was really good and the it wasnt crowded at all but it was also sunday evening. I had a there burger with pimento cheese and potatoe chips it was a great burger, i actually wasnt able to finish it which for me is aactually a big deal. the Fried pickles were great as well, the service was excellent which is nice because the time before I visited with my wife it was not the best experience we could have had. i am glad this was a better dining experience as it will add the Liberty to list places to frequent when we are in the south end.

Let's start by saying I love a good burger and was excited to try The Liberty, but unfortunately I was underwhelmed and unimpressed.  Took a birthday trip here with a friend and was immediately seated and greeted by our waitress. She was very helpful with beer selection even bringing samples. After settling on our beer choices I ordered a burger (can't remember which one) it was cooked perfectly medium and the fries were nicely salted. It was a nice size burger but lacking in flavor.   The food was good but I've had better burgers and I'm in no rush to get back.

Myself and several friends went to check out liberty and it was sub-par to say the best. Granted it is a new bar/restaraunt but the entire atmosphere feels more 'manufactured' than comfortable. The servers were not familiar with the menu and the food, while adequate, was not anywhere near the 20$ a plate price it commanded. They have a decent beer selection but it was overpriced and in the same breath the first couple choices on the menu we made they happened to 'be out of'. My advice is if you are looking for a fine dinning experience, definitely look elsewhere. If you are looking for a place to spend premium dollars on mediocre food and service then please be sure and stop in for a drink or some food.
Went here for a work lunch. I ordered the stuffed portobello and it was delicious! The food is always fresh and the wait staff is very attentive. Great place!

Wow!!  Haven't written a bad one in a very very long time.  The only reason I am now is the manager didn't have the decency to come over to address the obvious issues.  He left our server, who did an amazing job in a tough spot, hanging.  I find that to be the biggest fail of the entire experience.  Limited menu, not Michael's fault, mussels that smelled suspect, not Michael's fault, food not to our liking, not anyone's fault.  Michael,our observant and concerned server, went out of his way to try and make us happy.  No visit from manager.  I will hire Michael in a second.   Now we are sitting in Chili's getting something to eat after dropping $55, $15 of which for the great service.  Had very high hopes for supporting the local restaurant industry.

Had a very good meal of small plates and excellent service by Amanda tonight!  The highlights were the calamari, and the pretzels.  The BBQ shrimp was good but didn't compare to the ones I had in New Orleans, the wedge salad was very good but too many caramelized onions overwhelmed the other flavors.  I liked the grilled sausage but my daughter really didn't.  We loved the service we got from Amanda who made us feel welcome on a very busy night and anticipated our needs without ever having to be flagged down.   We would love to try some of The Liberty's other offerings the next time we come to Charlotte!

Was our first time coming but we will definitely be back. The Texas brisket sandwich was the bomb! I can see what some were saying about the warm beer (I just had a taster) but our experience was great!
Not a fan. The place looks really cool and trendy but they cants even make a good burger. No good local craft beer options which is crazy for a "trendy burger bar". Overpriced and poor service. Fail.

We went to The Liberty for the first time this past weekend.  I'd avoided it 'til now because I didn't really know enough about it.  "The Liberty" doesn't really tell me anything, and their logo looks like that of an insurance company's.  After the restaurant was recommended to me by several friends and looking at the photos online of the modern decor, we decided to give it a try.   I was impressed with the interior.  From the bland exterior, you wouldn't know that it actually has a modern, hip atmosphere.  The bar area is very roomy, too.  It's an actual room.  You can actually stand around and talk to friends without being squooshed.  The beer selection is pretty extensive, so I got to try a new pumpkin ale and a (sweet) cider I had never before heard of.    After we sat down at our table, our friends ordered the pork rinds appetizer; we ordered the crispy calamari fries.  I tried the pork rinds and they did have some good flavor, but I just can't eat them, knowing what they are and where they come from.  The calamari fries were fantastic, though.  They were so flavorful, and cooked just right.  They were actual strips of calamari instead of rings.  I could have eaten a bucketful.    I had heard such wonderful things about the burgers at The Liberty that, naturally, I had to try one.  I didn't realize, though, that burgers (plural) meant burger (singular).  There's one beef burger option on the menu.  We were a bit surprised.  My partner and I split the famous "Pub Burger" and the lamb burger.  The lamb burger was delicious.  It had a lot of flavor, and the toppings really complemented it.  The Pub Burger on the other hand was...just ok.  I'm not exactly sure why it was named "Best Burger in Charlotte."  It had the burger patty, lettuce, tomato, cheese, and bacon.  Your basic burger.  Good, but not exciting.  I've had much better burgers and better topping combinations at Big Daddy's (now Bad Daddy's), Nix Burgers, and, yes, even Red Robin.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get a Pub Burger.    All in all, I liked the casual atmosphere, the reasonable food prices, the drink options, and the calamari, but I was disappointed in the lack of exciting burger options and the Charlotte Observer's dubious distinction of "best burger."

Very disappointed. We sat at the bar at like 5pm on a Tuesday and the service was horrific. Bartenders extremely disinterested. One came and took our drink and food order and never came back.  Other bartender finally came over after we had finished eating and our drinks were empty for a while and checked us out. We didn't even care to stay for a second drink cause we felt unwanted and a burden.  Food was not impressive at all in my opinion and too expensive. $15.00 for a burger... better be amazing and honestly five guys tastes better. This place has good reviews so might try again and not sit at the bar.   Also maybe should have some type of uniform cause your waitress had on yoga pants, uggs and a cheetah tank on..... employee appearance and service have a huge affect on customer experience.. felt dirty and unpleasant.
Came in from NYC and was thrilled with the food here. The Montana steak and the duck fat potatoes were excellent. Highly recommended.

Myself and 4 girlfriends went here for dinner on cinco de mayo. The evening started off on a bad note immediately. There were only 4 chairs at the table and the waitress did not offer to get us another one, we fetched our own. It then took her a good 15 minutes to come and take our drink orders. When she finally got our drinks and took our appetizer order, a good 25 minutes later, I ordered the hummus plate and one of my girlfriends ordered the boiled peanuts. The peanuts eventually found their way to our table but after 30 minutes, still no hummus. When our fleeting waitress finally walked by our table, I flagged her down, inquiring about my hummus. She proceeded to stand there and tell my that I ordered my hummus as my meal. I quickly reminded her that I did not. I put it in with the app order and she even commented "you can never have too much hummus" in her deadpan voice. I also reminded her that the arugula salad was my entree. She finally agreed and went to check on my hummus. When it finally did arrive, it was accompanied by my meal...fine, whatever, at least I got it. Now, the description of my dinner salad was this, arugula, shaved pears, goat cheese, beets, pistachios and I added grilled chicken. Sitting in front of me was a bed of arugula with chicken and sliced apples. Nothing more. I flagged our waitress over and told her of the problem. Her response "whats supposed to be in it?" when I informed her of what was on her menu, she said "well I know we ran out of pears and they just throw whatever they have in there." NO. JOKE. What if I had been allergic to apples?!?! She took my plate back and returned with the semi-corrected dish, sans pistachios. By this time we were over this establishment and wanted out. Two of my girlfriends ordered margaritas that were straight up sour mix and they brought this to her attention as well. We inquired about speaking with a manager due to the lack of knowledge in the kitchen to the lack of apology from our waitress. She never apologized once. We were told that there were no managers on duty...what?!! We were given the managers business card instead. I have never in my life had a worse restaurant experience and would have given this place zero stars had that been an option. Next time, I'll opt for the three hour wait at Cantina 1511 before I'd ever return here.

Fun, festive atmosphere. Great selection of beer on tap. Interesting appetizers. The pretzels, calamari and sliders were great. The burger and fries were amazing. The Mac n cheese really had zero flavor. The dessert I got for my birthday was the layered pie and it was amazing....

I have been here for lunch twice and enjoyed it both times :) The fries are delicious! and I am a big fan of the Portobello mushroom sandwich (and I'm not even a vegetarian!). Friendly staff and comfortable atmosphere.

Poor service.... Decided to try out this new place and walked in for Sunday brunch...mildly busy... Seated quickly but no one returned with cutlery or ask for drinks for 20 minutes... Walked out and no apology or regret from ladies in front. Live locally in Blakeney area and certainly will not return.

Went to the Liberty last night with my wife and 3 daughters  for my wife's birthday.  Outstanding service and the food was top notch.  Short ribs with gnocchi side was perfect.  My wife and daughter both had the trout and said that it was great.  My other 2 daughters had chicken and dumplings and loved it.  Good craft beer and drink selection.  I highly recommend The Liberty.

Only reason we decided to eat brunch here instead of the Tupelo honey cafe across the street is because of the 2 hour wait at Tupelo. My advice: wait the two hours or simply skip brunch, either option would be better than the liberty. First of all, the service was awful. I would have liked to order a coffee, or an order of the biscuits for the table, but our server never gave us the opportunity. When our food finally arrived it was another disappointment. Half of the food was cold and my "breakfast sandwich" was so saturated in grease It was inedible. 10/10 would NOT recommend and will never be returning.
It's hard to choose between the awful service and the terrible food but one has to win the race toward horribleness. Literally nothing was good.

We have been here a couple of times before, and thought the burgers were pretty good.  After meeting some friends at a nearby restaurant that had an hour wait, we decided to go to The Liberty instead.  I guess I should have stuck with their burgers, but decided to try their fish and chips.  The coating on the fish was nice and crunchy, but the fish itself was awful!  Totally mushy and disgusting.  Normally I would have sent it back, but the server kept disappearing, and I didn't feel like being there any longer.  The place was mostly empty, no wonder.....

I really do not enjoy writing bad reviews for local businesses. I am not a fan of bad mouthing a company and potentially hurt the lively hood of people in my community. However, when those people do not care about your experience at a restaurant, or care about your business, then it makes it a little easier to stomach giving such a bad review.   I have now gave this place a shot on three separate occasions, when they first opened, a few months ago, and then this week. Each time it was not a pleasant experience. The second visit I did have good service. The food was not so good though.   After hearing they might have hopslam some friends and I decided to head over. As soon as we walked through their doors it was a bad experience. The hostess was not friendly, there was an open table by the bar and we asked to sit there. I am not sure why, she seemed to not want us to sit there but allowed us to do so. It took quite some time for anyone to take our drink order. The bartender came over after some time and took our orders. Still not very friendly. Unfortunately, they no longer had any Hopslam, but we new that may happen. So, we all ordered beers off of their awesome beer list and a friend ordered an appetizer. Some time later we got the beers. When we were almost done with the beers I stated that I did not think that he would be getting the food order. The bartender came back and asked if we wanted any food. I asked about the order already put in. The order was forgotten. No apologies or anything. Then without asking if we were done she brought the tab to us.   This was obviously an employee issue and not the restaurant itself. However, with my past experiences at this place it is not surprising. I seriously doubt I will be going there for a fourth time.

I think if you come here expecting a place the caliber of Soul Gastrolounge, you will be disappointed.  It  doesn't necessarily fit into what I would consider a 'gastropub,' (it's relatively standard in my opinion compared to other restaurants these days) but it's still really solid.  I can find no reason not to go here if you've already checked out a bunch of other restaurants in Charlotte.  Just don't expect to be astounded or anything.

I only put 3 stars because the staff was friendly and attentive, and the beer is well chosen. The food, however, was extremely disappointing. The burger was under seasoned, greasy, and way overcooked. There is nothing special about this place in my opinion.

The server was friendly and everything came in a decent amount of time for a party of 6.  They put cheese on 2 burgers that didn't request but other than that every thing came correct. I had the shrimp and lobster scampi and it was delicious!!!!If I lived in the area I would definitely be coming back for that!
Great beer on draft choices.  Had trout/pea risotto.  Husband had excellent burger.

Came for Charlotte restaurant week. Great menu selection. Great atmosphere. Bazooka guacamole was quite yummy. Attentive service. Glad we came for restaurant week because otherwise we would have spent double. Normal prices were a tad bit high. Great cocktails!

I came here with my husband for date night and I must say this place is awesome! Best burger I have found in Charlotte yet!   I got a burger with cheese and bacon on it with the garlic fries. They didn't have any cider for me to partake in, and the beer they had on special was out because they had a keg blow, but I really didn't need anything to take away from my heavenly burger experience. The burger was very well made medium and the fries were hot and awesome! They also have an aioli that is supposed to come on the burger, but I asked for it on the side, and the fries were very good dipped in it.   The ambiance in this place is really cozy and I think very romantic. Parking can be a pain in the rain and in the dark, but just pay attention to signs and you'll be ok.   My new #1 date night destination!

I went here with some friends for dinner a few weeks ago.  I thought this place might have a creative, interesting menu, but nothing caught my eye.  I ordered the burger because I wasn't feeling anything else and the menu said it was voted best in Charlotte.  Wow. Give me a break.  I ordered it medium, but it came out well done.  I was kind of tipsy and didn't notice until I had eaten half of it already.  So I just said **** it, and finished it.  It was hard to eat because it was stacked so tall, kind of annoying.  I don't understand how their burger won any award because it just wasn't that good.  It cost $13 too.  I can get a better burger at Pinky's, Diamond, or Penguin for half the price.  I won't be returning.

I'm going to have to agree with Amy and some of the other fellow yelpers this place could be 3.5 stars overall but it's definitely closer to 3 than 4 stars.   I'd heard mixed reviews about this place anyway but finally had the opportunity to give them a try for lunch. We arrived a little after 12:30 and the lunch crowd was stead but not overwhelming. We were greeted and seated right away.   Our waitress was nice- but just not as attentive as she could have been. Granted, it was the "lunch rush" but it wasn't nearly busy enough to see her so sparingly. That's definitely something that could use some work.   I ordered the Pub burger and fries. It was a standard burger - not the best I've ever had nor the worst. Just decent. But it was an absolute mess to eat. Be sure to get plenty of napkins. The fries were tasty, hand cut and seasoned well. I really enjoyed them.   Overall, I'm glad I went and gave them a try. But I'll continue to search for the best burgers in town.

My girlfriend heard rave reviews about this place. So we decided to go here for lunch. I had the Pub burger and she had the fish sandwich. Both items were great, this location to know for their burgers. The waiter was very nice and even moved the smokers away from the patio. I think she could tell it was bothering us. We plan to visit this place again soon.

I just ate at The Liberty in Blakeney for lunch with my family and had the worst experience I have had at any restaurant. Our food was not delivered to our table until 53 minutes after we ordered. Even when our server let us know that my 2 year old daughters kids meal Mac and cheese was on its way out, it was still an additional 20+ minutes, and it only came out when we asked to have our entire meal boxed up and brought out with the check, because we have 2 young kids and we're way passed nap time. We watched a nearby table with children leave just as frustrated and do the same thing with their meal being boxed up because it had been so long. Again, our servers were no where to be found, no management approached our table apologizing for the long wait, nothing. We dine out very frequently and will NEVER eat at The Liberty in Blakeney again. I can't wait to eat my meal now cold at home, thanks.

I have been to The Liberty several times.  Each time I went I felt like I was going to give it just "one more try."  The food is disappointing.  It always sounds better on the menu than it actually turns out.  I don't know what this "best burger in town" business is about, because I tried the lamb burger last time I was there and it was TERRIBLE.  The bun was so soggy it was falling apart, and the meat was bland (hard to do with lamb, I thought).  But perhaps even worse than the food is the service.  The servers are rushed, sometimes rude, or just not present.  I won't be going back to this restaurant again.

I went here a few weeks ago for a business lunch and my impression was just that it was average. I got the crabcake salad and it was okay. It wasn't a very good crab cake and the dressing was very bland. The greens were fresh though and the service was great. I would like to try it again in hopes that I will be more impressed next time. The liberty honestly left me a little bit disappointed.

Service was A-OK!  Glad we had a reservation for a Saturday afternoon, it was crowded.  Had a hamburger.  It was good.  Very good.  Not sure it was the best burger I ever had good, but it was in fact pretty good.  Good, but not great, beer selection.

Walking in the place has a nice ambience, we sat at the bar, apparently during a shift change because we were warned the kitchen was "off" and we got the distinct impression from the bartender that we should wait another 15 minutes before ordering (at 5), which we did.     My other half put his (empty) bar glass on the rail, she promptly dumped the ice out and walked off, about 20 minutes later came back and asked if he'd like another.  That's generally what setting a glass on the rail means, you'd like a refill.   The pork belly sliders were good, I didn't realize they didn't come with fries or any sides, obviously my mistake.    The lobster mac & cheese was okay, nothing to write home about and it's not something we'd order here again.   All in all, it's a cute pub with lots of room, over- priced for what you get & so-so service from seemingly inexperienced bartenders. A good one-time place, but I can say that there's very little chance we'd return.

Not sure what to say, it was the best of times, it was the worst of times...  I have been here several times and the food has been great, while other times it has fallen flat.  To some degree, the service has mirrored my previous statement.  I like the concept of a gastropub, and this one definitely has a consistent stellar beer selection, but my experience has been better with the pub part than the gastro part.  Like Forrest Gump said, "it's like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're gonna get".  While the above review covers about 6-8 experiences at The Liberty, I will say that the last couple of times there, for drinks only, with the wife, we have had very good service and of course the drinks/beer were great. I may just need to return for brunch, lunch or dinner and give them another try.  They may have turned the corner on their inconsistent food and service issues.
Went for brunch after church. Fun drinks. Good food. Different menu options. Awesome burgers. Fun atmosphere. Definitely will go back!

I have been wanting to try the Liberty forever but since it is outside of our normal "bubble"... we have not made it until this weekend.  We stopped in to have a beverage and grab a bite to eat.  The place definitely has a much more casual vibe than it did when it was MacIntosh's.   The bar area is pretty large and has a good mix of hightop bar tables and booths. We decided to grab a hightop and checked out the beer menu.  They do have a nice selection of beers and a decent selection of wines as well.  However, they seemed to be out of several of the items - both beer and wine that folks in our group were interested in ordering. That's always a disappointment.  But in any case, there were enough other choices that everyone was able to find something good to drink.   So, I had heard they have good food, but I wasn't really prepared for their menu or  their interpretation of some old favorites.  Things here are prepared with a little different twist than what you normally expect.  For example, we started with the calamari fries (around $10 or $12,  I believe). This version of calamari is served on a bed of some sort of asian-inspired slaw, and were drenched in some sort of red sauce - with a white sauce also drizzled about.  I couldn't quite put my finger on what the sauces were.   I would have to say this was not my most favorite calamari, but it was ok.   I decided to try the chicken & dumplings ($16) and this is the most unqiue take on C&D that I have ever seen.  It is not what I grew up with, but was tasty.  The chicken was pan roasted to perfection. Crispy on the outside, falling off the bone tender on the inside. The "gravy" was nothing like traditional southern chicken & dumpling gravy - this one seemed to have very little flour and was more like a light brown glaze.  It had a nice flavor though. To round out the dish, it was served with a few gnocchi, carrots, peas, mushrooms and a couple of spinach leaves.  I would eat it again for sure...but if you want a more "traditional" take on chicken & dumplings, you might want to skip this offering.   My sister ordered a salmon dish ($ unknown) which was served with a side of farro risotto and veggies.  I tasted the salmon & the farro and both were delish.     David and Michael both ordered burgers ($13) which are served with a side of hand-cut fries. They said  the burgers were pretty good, but not the "best burger in town" in their opinion.    I probably would not make a special trip to come here... but if I happen to be in the area & looking for a bite to eat, I'd certainly stop in to give them another try.

I usually don't leave bad reviews but this one is needed. Last night was my 3rd attempt at trying the place out and it was a fail at all 3 attempts. I really wanted to like the place. The first time was when they first opened so I gave it the benefit of the doubt on slow service when there were only 3 tables of customers. Second was just for drinks with friends and the drinks kept coming out poorly made. The third and last time was last night. I used open table to make reservations since we were told a few weeks ago that they were only taking reservations only and the place was practically half empty. Last night they ended up cancelling my reservations so I did not get the points for using the app. We waited about 20 mins just to have our drink order taken and then another 20 mins just to receive our drinks. The prosecco came out cloudy, flat and warm so I told the waitress and she said it's because we served you the one on tap, would you like it from the bottle? It sounded like they have had prior complaints of this and that's why they had the bottle option available. Well I waited another 20 mins for that glass of prosecco. As for the food, the wings were super fatty to the point my husband and I wouldn't even eat them and the pretzels tasted like they were microwaved. The husband of the couple next to us ended up going up to the bar for drinks for his family since they were there waiting about a half hour to even receiving any service.

The Liberty is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte because not only are the burgers terrific, but anything you order is quite delicious. The service is always good and the ambience is lovely. It's a very laid back atmosphere with perfectly lit dining rooms and bar. I bring friends here frequently because it's not so noisy that you can't have a conversation  (unless you're in the bar during a crazy game; they do have tvs in the bar area).  I highly recommend the Crunch Burger and the sublime homemade macaroni and cheese! Oh and did I mention they have a great selection of beers?

A gastropub it seems like this word has been popping up everywhere lately. I've been asked several times what a gastropub is and to be honest I'm not really sure. A gastropub to me is a casual joint that serves good beer and great food more upscale then a neighborhood pub usually has a large selection of small plates and great french fries. Every gastropub I've been to seems to be very hip. The web definitions vary from a public house, a drinking-establishment of British influence, a bar that serves a higher standard of food then a normal pub. You choose what you want it to mean, anyway you should definitely check one out. Like the Liberty.   I met a friend of mine for lunch at The Liberty and I thought the food was quite good. We shared the Ashley Farms Chicken Breast with Avocado, Havarti Cheese, Chipotle Aioli. The chicken was grilled perfectly and the roasted red peppers were a great plus. Did I mention the roll it was served on it was so soft and delicious. We also tried the Grilled Shrimp Salad with Bibb Lettuce, Tomato, & Lemon Vinaigrette, now this was pretty plain I think I could have made something better at home.   I don't want to leave out the crispy french fries though, they were some of the best I've had in town. I would definitely come again for lunch and maybe try dinner they have a great beer selection, and it looks like a fun place to hang out with some friends.

After hearing so many praises of delicious and memorable visits, gargantuan burgers, and overall amazement from The Liberty, we finally made it in for a late lunch last week. I had no idea what I was going to order, and after looking at the lunch menu, it seemed that a burger was choice.   The service was very friendly and appeased my neurotic disdain for the wobbly table on the patio, so we settled for a booth inside. Throughout our meal, our server was very attentive and friendly.   We started with some of the house-cured pickles and potato chips. Chips - ridiculously good. I've come to appreciate thick cut chips that are made in-house more than fries in the past few months. The pickles were great. Reminded me a lot of a NY halfsour from Stage Deli. Definitely would get those again.   My wife ordered a veggie sandwich and I ended up ordering the "Crunch Burger" which has won a few awards...from Southern Living I think?  The veggie sandwich was pretty standard and fulfilling. Plenty of veg, flavor and sustainability for a vegetarian. The burger....was just a little blah. I appreciate the approach. Especially with the potato chips on the burger, brioche bun, house-ground meat that was cooked to a nice med rare....it just didn't do anything for me. The tomato slice was close to a quarter of an inch thick, a very odd leaf of lettuce jetting out of the side, a small country's worth of pimento cheese, and so much bun....with so little burger. I think it would have been perfect if all of the other toppings had been just a bit smaller in portion. I guess I'm a bit of a purist when it comes to burgers. I appreciate the complex, but love when I can pick up my burger and get a little of everything in one bite. This burger just didn't deliver on that front.   I can definitely say I'll be back to the Liberty soon. I may venture for something other than a burger, but I look forward to trying more of the menu. Cheers!

Good burger but not great. Service was spotty, at best.  She came across as uninterested and somewhat annoyed we were there. We got the pretzel tower (which was awesome), but didn't get app plates until we were already finished with the app. Two beers were "out" with no apology. Probably won't be back anytime soon, though it was a decent meal. They are so close, just needs server training and better management.

So my friend & I missed the cut off for Sunday brunch, so we were presented a limited menu for the time between brunch & dinner. I went with the pork rinds & he had the young mixed greens salad with salmon.  The time between ordering & receiving our food was short. The presentation was top notch & I loved how good my pork rinds looked in the tin bucket, with the red & white checkered tissue paper. The rinds were still popping, as they just came out of the fryer! They were so amazingly good.  Waitress was nice & friendly. Attentive, but not overbearing. She laughed & commented at the fact I was able to finish the entire bucket of pork rinds by myself. :D  The patio seating seemed very nice, as we were seated in a booth next to the patio door.  Prices were reasonable. Parking is tricky!

Horrible service. Went in for lunch with my son. Took 10 min to even be greeted. Drinks another 10. Food was not good, and very overpriced.  Had to ask for our server several times and the check took forever. The table next to us experienced the same trouble. Will never be back. Don't waste your time or money going
Food- moderate.  Environment- TOO LOUD.  I wouldn't come back simply because of the acoustics.  So loud, couldn't even carry on a conversation with the person with me.

I just love this place! We always have a good consistently well prepared meal.  This time we had pork belly sliders, burgers, shrimp and grits, and fish and chips.  All served hot and no overcooked fish. Only caveat was the female bartender server who was not too attentive.

Summary:  Great ambiance, great location, and good food that does suffer just slightly in comparison to other options in Charlotte.  Took the family (wife, 3 teenager-ish kids, and parents), so had the opportunity to taste quite a few things...highlights:  - The pretzel's were very good - slight crunch on the outside, chewy on the inside -  but at $14 a little overpriced.  (Comparison - Flying Saucer)  - Pickle appetizer was well done - contrasting, sharp tastes that worked well in between main bites  - Shrimp and grits were some of the best I've had in Charlotte  - Mac and Cheese was good, not great.  (Comparison - Mert's)  - Pork Belly sliders had all the components of something great, but couldn't quite measure up to the execution of Soul Gastrolounge and their pork belly tacos.  Would like to know who can, though.  - Fantastic beer selection, including some of the locals you don't always see (Birdsong)  All in all, I do recommend hitting this place if you're in South End if you're in the mood for great beer, good food, and don't mind spending a few extra bucks.

Came out for restaurant week on a free meal ticket via Yelp- thanks Yelp!   We booked a reservation during a Friday night, and it was BUSY. While I'm on the topic of busy, my only complaint on our entire outing was that they kept us waiting 40mins past our reservation time. I was told that people who were coming in to dine were just not getting off their fat *****, and I could believe it. We did manage to find a small space open at the bar and had a few good drinks that, although not on special, were not overpriced.   Once we were seated, we got served right away and the waitress was extremely attentive the entire night.   The food we ordered was exceptional. Definitely worth a free meal! Heh. But in all honesty, yeah, we were both very impressed with the unusual dishes and flavor combinations. She would come back for the restaurant week menu, I would come back for their burger. Even at $15, they have me sold!
Had a layover in the city and was really wanting some good American food. This place delivered! Excellent salad and grilled cheese.

I have zero idea how this restaurant maintains making good burger lists. They're not bad buy not fantastic. I work across the street so I've been here many times. The service is terrible and the food is over priced. I've come here for mediocre food for the last time. Don't waste your time either. Go to Bad Daddy's if you want a good regular priced burger.

We walked over here from my friends apartment because it was such a gorgeous day out. I loved the little patio area - it was very cute and sunny.   The menu had a good range of american cuisine and even mussels - and you know I love those - but everyone kept getting these amazing huge burgers - so I gave it and got one too. They have a big sign up that says they were voted best burger in Charlotte - so that also pushed me to give it a go.  I can't eat fries and those of us going low-carb alternatives appreciate a great salad. They couldn't sub the fries for the salad, but they did do an upgrade for it, so I had a wedge and burger with no bread on it. The burger was awesome - very big though!  My friends had the organic chicken sandwich and the veggie burger - they said both were great!  We enjoyed some cocktails from the bar as well as the over all sunshine of the patio. The chairs could be a little more comfortable out there, I had to use my purse as a back cushion because I kept sliding backwards and the service was a little slow, but over all it was a very relaxing, casual, chill little spot for lunch.  I would return - next time I am going to try the mussels for sure.

Visited for restaurant week and while the trout I decided upon was good that was the highlight of the three courses.   My dinner partners seemed to enjoy the pork chop that they ordered.  The budino was a bit confusing to to the taste buds. However it was my first time having one so that could contribute to my confusion. The menu descriptions were a bit misleading I believe and that might have been a part of the issue. All three of us made statements about what we thought the appetizer, meal or dessert would be based upon the menu. I might give them another try outside of restaurant week seeing that they have such great reviews.

The burger was amazing, it was cooked perfectly. They have a lot of different ones to choose form as well, definitely one of the best burgers I have had in Charlotte. It was crowded but we were able to sit in the bar area no problem. Outside patio area looked nice as well, good for a cool summer evening.

This place was pretty good. The "Natural Crunch Burger" was amazing. The fries are just ok. But overall, it was good and I'll be going back to try some other things on the menu. Can't get much more convenient to the light rail line.

We figured it would be a good idea to take the Light Rail into town and just walk around until we found somewhere to grab lunch that had outside seating. We figured East/West Station would be a good place to start, so we headed out.   We were originally intrigued by Tupelo Honey Cafe, which is right next to The Liberty, but we were told it would be a half hour wait for outdoor seating. Too long for us, so we went back downstairs to the outdoor seating area we had seen when walking over. We walked into The Liberty and were seated immediately, but not before we caught a glimpse of the inside room to the left of the main entrance, but more on that later. There were very few tables that actually had other people, so there was no wait at all.  The food was good. I ordered the brisket sandwich, which was huge but not too spectacular. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't to die for. We all ordered burgers or sandwiches, and they were all pretty big, which is absolutely wonderful - you definitely get your money's worth!   The service was great and the location is convenient, but it is right across the street from a fire station. So your meal may be interrupted by some loud sirens. It didn't bother us at all, but I can see how that could annoy some people.   But back to the interior of the place: The room to the right of the door seemed to be your standard restaurant with a bar and booths/tables. But to the left, there's a yellow glow. There's a very mellow lighting in the room, with high ceilings, complete with towers of kegs, if my memory is correct. It was a very very cool room, and I would love to dine in there at some point. It's something that I'm not sure how to describe, but it was very unique. There's also a basement dining area, and I believe that is used to host events.

I want to like the Liberty. In fact, the first time I ate there it was great. The burgers are really good but it stops there.  Tonight I visited and was going to share the pub burger with my wife. They cut the burgers when you share, which I like. I ordered it and requested Brussels sprouts instead of fries. I clarified that I could have the sprouts in place of the fries and specifically asked that they were included with the burger. The server said yes. I also ordered an extra side of green beans.  When the food arrived all looked okay except the paltry portion of green beans for $5. I'm not a chiseler, I'm really not. And when things are good I am willing to pay for them. But the green beans were barely half of a ramekin. I clarified with the server that this was in fact my side and not part of my son's kids meal. She confirmed it was mine and proceeded to bring him and even ridiculously smaller portion of green beans as if to make her point.  Then, when I got the check, up charge for the sprouts. $2 dollars! Again, not a chiseler and not particularly cheap. It's the point that I wasn't told before. Terrible way to treat your customers. Also, I've had much better Brussels sprouts.  I unfortunately won't be back. I am not a fan of nickel and diming customers, especially when a restaurant isn't forthright about it. Can't wait for Mark and Donnie's burger joint up the street!

So, The Liberty definitely has my vote after serving as the venue for our rehearsal dinner. "The Liberty????," you may be thinking... and my answer is, I know, a tid bit unconventional but AMAZING! First, The Liberty has one of the most affordable private rooms in the greater-uptown area. Their private room seats up to 60 people comfortably and provides a very intimate setting for private events. Second, they totally understand how to work with a budget. I essentially gave them a dollar amount, a few parameters, and the fabulously talented staff at The Liberty figured out the rest. Our rehearsal dinner guests LOVED the food, especially the shrimp and grits and mac n' cheese (I should have ordered 4 times the amount of mac n'cheese that I ordered because everyone went back for seconds, thirds, and fourths until it ran out). The service was amazing, the bartenders and waiters were very patient with our very thirst and hungry bunch. The cherry on the sundae of the perfect dinner was that the bill actually would up being a bit less, that's right, I said less... than we anticipated -which is always a nice surprise!  I hope to never get married again, and will therefore never need to plan another rehearsal dinner, but I will DEFINITELY suggest The Liberty for corporate events, retirement celebrations, engagement parties, you name it! Chef Matt and his crew truly were a pleasure to work with!

We won't be back. Reservation was for 6:45 and we were seated quickly.  Our food arrived after 7:45 (more than an hour after arriving) and people who arrived after us were served their dinners before us. We asked the hostess to check on the status of our orders and she ignored us the rest of the night. In the hour and 20 minute ordeal our server came by to ask about our drinks twice. I have no idea where he was for the rest of the 80 minutes.  But how did it taste? The shrimp and pasta was bland and didn't have any garlic or salt and pepper. The barbeque was mild (no bite) or texture. The chicken Caesar salad drowned in the dressing. Too much money for the food quality and "ambiance."

My husband and I had a taste for a burger. We were headed over to Tupelo Honey, but saw the "best burger in Charlotte" sign in front and decided to give The Liberty a shot. We walked in, it was quite empty- maybe 3 people inside. There was no one to greet us, so we began to walk to the bar. There were two employees behind the bar, a male and a female. The female employee looked up from what she was doing, and looked back down. I began to ask, "do we seat ourselves?" The male employee looked back our way and then turned back to what he was doing. Needless to say, we made an about-face and walked right out and over to Tupelo. Clearly, the staff believes business is going so well at The Liberty that they can be rude and dismissive to customers.  If you're looking for a tasty bite to eat, walk on across to Tupelo Honey. They were friendly, and the food was super good!

I like upscale gastropub food and decor and ambiance. That is why The Liberty is my favorite place in Charlotte, or at least the most visited. Lots of good beer to choose from and I have not been disappointed with any of my food choices. Usually I get the lamb burger, the pepper jam / relish is great. It is loud but not too loud and the service and prices are good but not next level. Plan ahead bc it gets crowded and parking is tough, but I am rating the inside of the restaurant and not the madness outside.

Arrived here for brunch and immediately loved the amount of patio space. We had to wait a few minutes before receiving our waters, but our waitress was pretty friendly so we brushed it off.   We ordered the deviled eggs as an appetizer. They came out with no candied bacon (which was described as having it on the menu) so we had to send them back. They came back with "regular" bacon and it tasted like regular deviled eggs. Nothing I need to have again. The mimosas were really good. Also, on Sunday's they are $4 so that's a plus.  The entree was amazing! I had the Croquet Madame and it was really good. It came with a green salad that was also pretty tasty.   We will definitely be back!

Burrrr it's really cold in here. Make sure you bring a jacket or a snowsuit. Ok, maybe not a snow suit hahhahaaa. So, we started off with a $3 mimosa. Sounds good right? We'll, they either used cheap champagne or watered down oj. It was not good.   They only had a few items on the brunch list. About 7 to be exact. I thought I knew what I wanted until I ordered and the waitress said "sorry we are out of biscuits, would you like toast?" Um no. So I got the big breakfast sandwich instead.   My sandwich was AMAZING. The potatoes that came with it were ok but more like dinner potatoes. I will definitely come back because I really want to try their biscuits. Oh how I love a good biscuit.  Be careful and look at your receipt. On the receipt it has subtotal, donation, tip and then total. I had never seen that before so I added the tip on the donation line and the total on the tip line smh. I was able to fix it before our waitress came back to get it.

Meh  The calamari fritters did not have the curry flavor I was expecting; the sauce on them was more of a tangy barbecue - which frankly, is not really what I want on calamari. The waitress also advertised to me that the burger was voted the best burger in Charlotte so I had high expectations. The burger was pretty meh, really nothing special or memorable. In fact, I needed mayonnaise just to put some flavor in it. The decor is really cute, but other than that - meh!

The food here is generally good and I would generally have recommended it if you were in the area and wanted a burger, but we had a terrible experience there and I reflected on it for a few days before I took about 20 minutes to send an email to them hoping that they would make things right.  I neverd hear back (it has been over a month).  I was really disappointed.    This is what I wrote:  The Liberty has always been one of our casual favorites and I'm genuinely sad that I'm not sure we'll be back.  We had 3 adults and 2 kids (1 was a non eating baby) and tried to order a burger, 2 chicken and dumplings, and kids chicken tenders.  We were informed that you were out of chicken tenders.  I looked around and at 6:45 there was only 1 other table in the dining room so I was confused.  My three year old daughter flipped out, which you will understand if you have kids.  After 10 minutes I was able to convince her to get the grilled cheese and fries. The waitress went away and came back five minutes later to inform me that you were out of grilled cheese. At this point I could not believe that a restaurant would be out of bread and cheese, especially considering my husband's burger had cheese on it.  The restaurant was nearly empty and why would a restaurant open for dinner without something like bread. There are so many Harris Teeter's around to buy bread if need be.  At this point it was an hour after we sat down, my daughter was hungry and melting down, and I asked the waitress if should could quickly bring us just a few fries or something since we still had no food so we could figure things out. Ten minutes later we got an entire order of fries (that we were charged for) that she described as VERY VERY HOT. I could barely touch them - completely defeating the purpose of them.  It was another 10 minutes before they cooled down enough for my daughter to actually eat a few. I found a Nutri-Grain bar in my purse and that ended up being what she ate as you were out of all kids meals.  Another 20 minutes later, the chicken and dumplings came out- the chicken was super dry looking/tasting and I had a total of three gnocchi in my order and my friend had four.  Were those sold out as well!?!  By the time we left over two hours later (again, terrible with 2 small kids) there were 4 seated tables.  There was no reason for this meal to take this long!  Three of the four people at our $100+ dinner went home and ate.  I would really appreciate some insight as to what was going on and hope you are able to rectify the situation.

I have been to Liberty a few times now. And I'm still not sure if I should give it a 3 or 4. The food wasn't memorable to me. But the biggest problem I have is that I can't keep up with the menu. Chef changes it all the time. I went 2 days ago and got a small plate of meatballs. When I looked up the menu online, the meatballs wasn't listed on there so I don't know the proper name to my dish. I guess I'm the type that if I really like something from a place. I will continue to go back and get the same thing. I had the pork skin and the boiled peanuts that I loved but is no longer on the dinner menu.  I also order the small plate of the mussels. By all means its NOT small. It was really good. But just couldn't finish it.  Their customer service was good on someday and excellent on other days. My recent visit, she was good. Our table didn't have any salt or pepper so I was stuck w.a slightly bland meatballs.  Overall I will come back. Hopefully they will bring back the boiled peanuts. And I will find something I like. They do have a lot things on the menu I would like to try.

Not trying to bash this place, but we had the worst experience here from top to bottom. APPALING service and food and it wasn't even busy. No manager was on duty. The bacon burger didn't come with bacon. It came with raw onions that resembled slugs instead. Salad consisted of lettuce and little else. Like I said I don't mean to bash this place but this was the worst experience I've ever had in a restaurant in my life and I've worked in service for 10+ years.

Went here for lunch a few weeks ago.  I really dug the decor.  This is first and foremost a pub, but they've switched up the traditional pub look with a modernist beer theme (lots of casks and gold liquid used throughout the space).    As an appetizer, my lunch-mates and I ordered the pretzels, which were fine--nothing different than you would find anywhere, and I thought the sauces weren't especially tasty. For our entrees, the waitress steered me away from the bland (her words) veggie plate and to the chicken & dumplings.  When it arrived, I was disappointed to learn that the chicken was all dark meat--possibly my least fave thing to eat!  I went back to the menu to see if it had stated that chicken was actually dark meat but such info was conspicuously absent.  And, yes, I know that it is fashionable to eat dark chicken meat these days, but I just cannot get with that.  I loathe sending food back--LOATHE IT!!--but dark chicken meat is too much for me to bear, so I finally flagged down our waitress and asked if the uneaten dish could be returned.  She was highly reluctant to send it back, which rubbed me the wrong way, and I actually had to push her to send it back.  I get the feeling that she was new, but, given that this is probably the third time in my life I've ever sent food back to a kitchen, I was pretty shocked by her attitude. When she finally took my food back to the kitchen and permitted me to reorder, upon the advice of my lunch-mates, I chose the fish and chips.  This dish was quite good, and I would highly recommend. Unfortunately, my meal arrived long after everyone else's, so I had to do that awkward eating-after-others-have-already-eaten-and-want-to-leave thing.  Not so cool.  We considered dessert, but they only had two options, and our waitress didn't do a very good job of selling either one.   Rereading the above, I'm not exactly sure why I'm giving the Liberty 3 stars.  I actually started with 4 stars, but after reflecting on my experience, quickly dropped it to 3 and now I'm even questioning that high of a score.  I guess my gut tells me that most of the issues I had were a direct result of having a yuck waitress and a poorly described menu, and, despite everything, I am willing to come back and give this place another shot.  So, I would suggest that the Liberty keep their interesting decor and fish and chips but update and refine their menu descriptions, train their waitresses better, have more desserts and a dessert menu.

The first time I went to the Liberty, I had the fish and chips, which were very good. Then they revamped the menu... On another trip my beer was served with a broken burger stake in it which caused shards of wood to become stuck in my throat. Really ruined my experience. Don't plan to return.

This place is no joke....food it just good...all of it. I have been several times and when I want a burger this is where I go. If you wanna go all out get the Crunch Burger, if you want just a good ole burger get the pub burger. The fries are soooooo good. The service at lunch is fast and consistant. I have never had a bad meal here. When i take people to lunch and they say they have never been this ias where we go and I always gigle at the folks piling in at Tupelo across the street cause I know that I am getting the better meal!

Yummy!  Had the crackling pork rinds and steak and eggs for brunch. Had to stop myself from ordering another round of everything. Service is super friendly and quick. Just one thing - eggs cannot me made to order. Would love the steak and eggs with poached eggs instead of fried.

Walked in and half the tables were open. They were all being held for reservations. The first available reservation was 2 hours later. We walked out, no attempt to stop us. It's a shame they lost out on a table with half of their tables empty.

The Liberty had a little bit of a wait around 8 PM on a Friday night, but not too bad and service was very quick. We ordered the macho nachos, and two burgers and asked for the food to come out quickly, since we had to be out within the hour.   Our waitress confused part of the order - one salad didn't have dressing on the side, the two salads were different even though we ordered the same one, and one burger had cheddar instead of pimento on it.   Once the orders were right, the food was absolutely great and very filling.   ... and then our check was wrong and they overcharged us by 8+ dollars. They corrected it when we raised it, but why should we have to?

Alright so people seem to like this place so my boyfriend and I decided to have lunch before the Panther's game on Saturday. We each got a different burger to share, fried pickles to start and then fries and mac and cheese as sides. We basically order everything with the intentions of sharing lol. The fried pickles were horrendous... seriously the breading was thick and weird and the sauces were hot sauce and a buttermilk blue cheese. I asked for ranch (which is listed on the menu as them having it) but the waitress said they only have the blue cheese or like honey mustard. We could have done without ordering that for sure.  The burgers were burgers and the fries were fries, and the mac and cheese tasted like the homemade kind my mom makes. I love my mom and her mac and cheese reminds me of my childhood but it's nothing special if I'm honest. That is pretty much how we would describe all of their food. It's not bad but it'd definitely not special and it tastes like what you would have at a family cookout. We just weren't impressed for the pricing. Service was lackadaisical but not awful... so I mean essentially our whole experience was meh okay. I feel like the menu could be amazing but it was so lacking in flavor. Pretty much not somewhere we'll be going back to.

First of all, this would be a solid 5 except that I have yet to have anyone who had not perfected the dismissive, pouty eye roll of a 13 year old girl at the greeter station. It really does cast an initial pall over the evening. Service is not the best, in general.  The food, however, is fabulous! I have yet to try something that is not wonderfully crafted with a delightful flavor profile to delight the taste buds from start to finish!  The appetizers are different than the standard fare and I surely appreciate that! Pork 'popcorn' that are fresh, mouth sizzling pork rinds!  Seasonal pickle plates and Devils on Horseback (dates, blue cheese, almonds and bacon) are spectacular!    Entrees are on a well edited menu. There is no so much that you are overwhelmed, but regardless of what you are in the mood for, you'll likely find a good option.   Short ribs that are delightfully tender and moist, but not at all mushy. Normally served on a bed of rib sticking mashed potatoes, but I substitute with the sauteed mushrooms. Fish and chips that any Englishman would write home about. Savory bangers and mash. Scottish salmon and, on the word of many dining companions I hear the trout is fabulous, the one thing I won't eat there...or anywhere.   My husband considers himself a burger aficionado, he's eaten them around the world...he counts the Pub Burger among the top 10 burgers out there. Brioche bun is grilled, cheese is melted but not too dripping and gooey. Herb aioli is delightfully seasoned and perfectly flavored.  Fries are always crisp and perfectly done.  BE SURE TO SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT!  And I really advise you look at nothing on the dessert menu and just have them bring a budino for the table.  It is easily enough for 4 people, usually 6.  The trick is to take your spoon and go straight down, all the way to the cookie base, and then pull it back up making sure you have each layer on your spoon. Then sit back and E N J O Y!  It is creamy, salty, sweet, crunchy, smooth...fantastic! Oh yes, oh YES!

Great food. Service needs attention - it can be hit or miss.   Admittedly, I've spent a number of lunches, holidays, and Restaurant Weeks here and I couldn't wait each time! The food is very, very good. For holidays, they have offered a dessert bar...start there. Always start with dessert.   Solid stop to fill you up and make your belly full and your tastebuds happy.

One of the worst run restaurants I have ever been to. Went with a group of friends, will never return.  This was not the first time we have encountered problems here, thought we'd give it one last shot...nope, never again!  Service is awful, food over cooked....actually had to go out for dinner after our three hour "dinner" too bad, great location.  Simply don't understand why the owners seem to not care....

As a Ballantyne area resident and huge enthusiast, (because traffic is ew) I was so excited to see a new place open up, but I feel like they need to better work on customer service. Our visit started when we walked in and waited for the hostess who came right away and proceeded to seat us inside - there were a lot of tables outside and no one was sitting inside because it was a gorgeous day. She didn't bother asking, I mean maybe just maybe we would rather wait for an outdoor table than sit inside....alone. So I asked and she said she's pretty sure it's full, but went to check. One table was empty and being cleaned and she placed us outside - the seating experience was just a big turnoff. Our waitress was much better than this hostess, she kept our drinks full and food took long but she kept us updated. Food: I ordered their grilled wings with the sriracha maple sauce, and I requested for flats only. My mom had their French dip burger with a side salad. The food took too long considering it was not a busy time (after 2 pm), but everything came out well and they only included wings that are flat for my order, and my mom enjoyed her burger and salad. I really liked my wings - perfectly sauced and crispy with great grill marks! Our waitress, Kendall and food quality definitely elevated our experience after how we felt about seating.

If possible I would give The Liberty a 3 1/2, but it's definitely closer to a 3 than a 4.   This was my first trip to The Liberty.  I went early evening (just before 5) with 2 girlfriends for after work TGIF drinks, apps, meals, desserts.  It was easy to spot right off of South Blvd.  Parking was plentiful, as we were quite early.  It's a well-paved, well-lit lot.  As we left around 7:30 or so, the lot was quite full, but this is right next to Pewter Rose and a gay bar (?) that I seem to remember reading about on the local paper online edition, and they share the large-ish lot.   We sat at a booth in the bar area.  It's a large bar with high chairs and 2 big flat screen TVs.  It has several high-top tables to accommodate large groups or smaller 4-top tables, and had 4 booths against the windows so you can view the traffic/walkers on South Blvd and the people coming in and out of Fuel Pizza.  If you like men in uniform, the fire station is directly across the street, so that is nice, but the sirens may also cause some beer spillage.  Once it is time for ambiance, they dim the lights, so make sure you have an app installed on your smart-phone that serves as a flashlight.  You will also need this if you have to go to the restroom directly behind the hostess stand, it's a dark hallway and hard to see exactly where you are going.  It's also a one-person restroom, so if you like to have meetings in the ladies room, you will be disappointed.  Comfy seating in the booths.  The drinks... wide selection of beer and wine.  My dinner dates had some kind of seasonal pumpkin ale.  They said it was good.  I had a Diet Pepsi.  (y u no serve Coke?).  The food.... we ordered fried pickles and pretzels with spicy mustard and/or cheese fondue for dipping as appetizers.  The fried pickles were very crispy and served with a ranch sauce and a tobasco/hot wing sauce, they tasted very good - I liked the crispness of the pickles and the pickles themselves tasted good.  I tried the wing sauce, wasn't a fan and stuck with the ranch.  The pretzels were VERY good.  Served warm with a sprinkling of salt with a cheese fondue that was creamy and delicious.  I am not a fan of spicy mustard, but I did try it.  It was mildly spicy.  And it was mustard.  (go for the cheese!)  For entrees, two of us got the pub burger which was a nice-sized burger that was flavored well and juicy, served with bacon, cheddar, grilled balsamic onions, lettuce, maters and aioli with a pickle stabbed on top of it on a brioche bun.  This will be a knife and fork burger after the first bite - it goes everywhere - I felt like I was covered in beef juice and mayo (that's what she said).  Typically served with french fries with rosemary, parmesan and chives, I asked them to skip all of that crap and just put salt on my fries.  The fries were hand cut and tasted very good - crispy without being hard with a nice fresh flavor (think Five Guys with a flair).  Our other dining companion had the BBQ sammich, again served with fries, and she said it was quite good as well.  It looked good and was a large sandwich.  Dessert.... we split a chocolate walnut torte served with chocolate sauce and vanilla bean ice cream.  Very good!  It tasted like a light chocolate cake with walnuts in it, served warm.    Service was... well... mediocre at best.  The waitress was friendly without being annoying when we saw her.  When we first arrived, we were one of maybe 3 tables there and it seemed that they were staffed well enough to handle 3 tables.  Empty glasses stayed empty for a while, and from appetizers to ordering dinner was an eternity.  While the service wasn't bad, it was inattentive for the number of people that were seated.  They would have sold quite a bit more beer to our table had she been a little more attentive.  However she was pleasant and did seem to know the menu relatively well even though from other reviews and what she said, the menu changes quite often.    The food was good, but because the service was slightly lacking, The Liberty would not be my first choice for a meal, but if someone wanted to go, I would not say no.  Try it out!

This is one of those times that I wish they would let you give half star ratings, as I would like to give the Liberty 3.5 stars.  Nice warm feel to the place, some of the decor seemed a bit cheesy but comfortable overall. I would also get rid of the exposed keg cooler with windows. The rest of the place has nice warm colors, but this keg cooler has windows and the lighting inside is a harsh bright light, and has all of the tap lines visible. Kind of an eye sore.  The beer menu is fairly extensive, and has some great beers both on tap and in bottles.
