The only issue that I have with the beer menu is that there is very little description of  each beer, and there are no food/beer pairing suggestions. I would also like to see a place like this have a few more taps, I think they have around 20 beers on tap now; 30-40 would be better (IMHO)  The food is outstanding, my wife had the braized short ribs and I had the shrimp and grits. Both dishes were terrific. A little pricey, but definately worth it. We went for dinner each had two beers, a main course, and an appitizer to split and after tip our bill was around $70.  The service was really good, our waitress was attentive, not overly pushy, and helpful with the menu. Overall the experience was very enjoyable.   I would definately suggest the Liberty to anyone looking for a good beer-centric restaurant with better than pub fare food. I will still stick with Duckworths if I just want to stop and have a pint or two, but this is a great choice for great food paired with good beer.

Absolutely LOVE The Liberty.   Hands down my favorite place in Charlotte for good food and a good drink. The menu is awesome- love the mussels with the grilled bread. Best burger in Charlotte, by far. My boyfriend is a huge fan of the lamb burger. Lobster mac & cheese, sauteed mushrooms, southern crunch burger...just a few of my favorites. Fried pickles come with a side of creamy hot sauce...genius. Homemade pretzels are amazing as well.   Great ambiance, most of the time we go we sit in the bar area. Great service. Love this place.

Went for lunch on our last day on Charlotte. The parking lot was jam packed, but we were able to find street packing near by. We were surprised that the restaurant was empty, so I guess everyone was going to the place next door. Service was prompt and the waitress was friendly. We had some soft pretzels, a pulled pork sandwich and a beef brisket. Everything was good, but nothing out of this world. For lunch it was nice, but nothing special.

What a show.  Stacked beer kegs, brewing rooms and a wall of beer (Yes...truly).  Ok.  It will be OK as they do have beer.  Took the grand kids for lunch and later got really skeptical looks from wife and daughter-in-law about just what was I doing there with the kids.  It was OK as the kids loved it.  The menu is southern in so many ways, like BBQ pork and sausage and mac & cheese and lots and lots of gourmet burgers.  At least 15 or more on the lunch menu.  And beer, but not for the kids, to their dismay.  Anyway, going on a date here or just with a bunch of guys &/or gals there are lots to munch on and the flavors are terrific.  Service is great and the beer is cold and good.  And I discovered that they have over 30 wines by the glass.  Amazing.  A little pricey, but there are kid portions.  It is called a gastropub and now I know what one looks like.  You will, also.

Burgers!!!!!  Roasted red pepper and goat cheese is crazy good.    The bar area is the only area I eat at and it is really spacious.  I love the long high top table since people can stand around or sit and socialize.

Lunch was o.k.,  but not worth the $50 cost for the 3 of us. We started with the Truffle oil cheese fries which my daughter enjoyed but were too cheesy for me. My wife ordered the fish sandwich with a side of baked beans. Both were good, and the fish was very fresh. I ordered the crunchy burger with a side of cole slaw. The size of the portion was great, but even with the chips and pimento cheese on top, the flavor didn't blow me away. My daughter's plain burger was just that, plain. A burger should taste like something even if it's naked. The dog disagreed with me, we took the leftover home to her and she gave it 2 paws up. For $50 including tip (the waitress was nice ) but without drinks (we drank water) , I don't think we'll be back.

The Liberty is growing, and perhaps this location in South End is in a state of transition.   A recent experience that we had this past Sunday was not good: Long (45 minute) wait for beer & food, unhappy service staff, semi-raw bacon served with a rather small, sad pancake that was missing the apples... and they were out of the duck poutine. :(      It's a shame when a place doesn't meet your expectations - especially on a holiday weekend outing with the whole family in tow. We have been coming to this restaurant since it opened, and typically leave with the feeling it was time and money well spent. But everyone has bad days - and this includes restaurants.     Though I must say that Matt, the owner/manager, is a good guy who stands behind his employees. He has always made us feel important and been accommodating. Their fries & burgers are hard to beat and the poutine is a real treat. Scottish Salmon with Farro is super solid. Let's hope that the Liberty continues to provide chef-driven, top quality cuisine - with integrity - for many more years to come and keeps the right to call itself a "Gastro-Pub."     Go ahead and give The Liberty a try... we'll be back for some duck poutine, let's hope that they are ready for us.

So disappointed in this place and see no reason to return...even though I wanted to for the burger.  We went for restaurant week and this was a place I'd wanted to try. Perfect!  Parking was pretty busy for a 6:00 reservation, but I don't hold that against the restaurant, just a warning for the next chick.  First course was the Brew Master's Plate - hand-cranked sausage, house pickles, spicy mustard, fresh-baked pretzel, Tillamook pimento cheese fondue - Sounds great! - THE SAUSAGE WAS RAW, PINK, MUSHY AND RAW. So, when I asked the server if it was supposed to be pink, she said yes. NO- It isn't.  When she took the plate with the raw sausage still on it - I told her, that it was raw.  No apologies.  She did have another whole plate sent out - I DIDN'T WANT ANYMORE and kindly told the other server who brought it out that I didn't want it.  My stomach was already turning because of the raw bite of sausage that I ate.    Then the second course - I got the 'steak and potato'.  Steak was fine - kind of hard to mess that up.  Potatoes were overfried/burnt fries...gag.  My husband got the "Chicken & Dumplings"  They shouldn't call it that.  It is 2 pieces of dried out, roasted chicken pieces dark & white over a roux, veggies and few gnocchi.  Dessert was good. Salted Caramel Budino - chocolate cookie crust & fresh whipped cream.  Beer had a really good selection, but that wasn't our focus.  Throughout the entire meal not one apology for serving raw sausage - because of this - they get one star and I will never be back.  There is bad lighting, but make sure you check your food going forward.

Great restaurant, wasn't able to actually try the food as there was too many people in line tonight we came. Good news they are able to accommodate large parties so if you have a large group this is a great place to bring your people.   The location is convenient as it is close to everything downtown. The ambiance was great and it smelled really good. Too bad we weren't actually able to try anything. The staff was nice and the hope hopefully next time for the large party that I came with.    **Please pardon my mistakes as I'm using Siri to dictate
Time for a delicious burger!  Fried pickles, a bloody Mary, a burger and fries?!?!! There was not a crumb left on my plate! If you are in the mood for a burger, you can't go wrong at The Liberty!

Pretty damn tasty place for brunch. Great ambience inside, you feel cool just being there.  We had the poutine fries to start and I ordered the brisket Benedict. Brisket was a little tough but overall the flavors were yummy.   Parking at this place is scarce and you may be stalking people in the parking lot on a busy day.. I've had to park across the street and walk over for this little area of shops and restaurants before. I'll definitely come back to try more.

Came here for dinner one night with my husband and brother. I am a vegetarian and felt a little disappointed they didn't have more options to choose from. Even the main dish of macaroni and cheese said it was topped with bread crumbs that had been cooked in duck fat.  My brother got the burger and was super happy with it and I tried his fries which were delicious. My husband got their fish and chips and he was fairly pleased with his. The fries were the best part of both they agreed.  We ordered an appetizer of fried pickles and while they were ok they had a lot of breading and a whole lot of grease. I don't mind a little but I felt like this was a lot in my opinion.

Location, atmosphere and menu were terrific.  Execution (mainly the service) left something to be desired.  The restaurant was practically empty.  There seemed to be plenty of employees, but our food was cold.
I've had poutine made by Canadians. This is not it. Lots of cheese and gravy but so not the right cheeses. Plus we are the only people at the bar and the BT is no where to be found.
the lobster cheese fries were so delish! the drinks were good, the prices were just fine, and the burger was too juicy to pick up. knife and fork it, baby!

The Liberty is a nice balance of great place to eat AND easy place to drop in and grab a drink and snack.  They have a large number of rotating drafts and a decent selection of wines by the glass (including a $6 house wine - thank you!).    On Tuesdays, all drafts are only $4 and you can order ENDLESS POUTINE.  That's right, endless.  While I did not go down the endless poutine road, this seems to be an awesome option for a filling snack while enjoying $4 beers - just don't plan on ordering any dinner!    I love the burgers at The Liberty - they are large, cooked to specification and oh so tasty.  The burgers come with fries (with or without truffle oil), though I prefer to sub an order of their delicious brussel sprouts.  You can also get a number of salads with any type of protein they have on hand - burgers, shrimp, salmon, scallops, steak, etc.    The service is exceptional and the decor is beer-chic, if that makes any sense at all.  This is a consistently good choice for brunch, lunch or dinner.

Less than impressed with Queen's Feast Week.. Sadly, our second courses were not worth our time or money. The wait staff seemed nice however, our specific server needed an attitude adjustment. We won't be back

Love the food here. As of now this is my favorite chef in town. Great use of flavors and local cuisine. Not super pricey and a lot of bang for your buck. I eat red meat, but I'm a red meat snob. I won't eat a pub burger out anywhere but here. The duck fat fries are amazing. If you are afraid of gravies ask for it on the side.I recommend everything on the menu. If you would eat it somewhere else, try it here. The food is like something you would dream came from a french countryside home, butchered out back and cooked in a big old black iron skillet. I just ate, but know I'm hungry again. ;)

For a place that touts itself as having the best burger in Charlotte, I was disappointed.  The first time I went I had the Liberty Burger with fries.  I asked for my burger medium and it came out well done and the fries were soggy.  The second time I went, I ordered the same thing.  This time the fries were well cooked, but again, the burger was well done (my dad also asked for medium and got well done).    The food was fine, but I expected more.  Also, it takes a while for your food to come out after you order, so be mindful of that if you go during work. My office is just a couple of minutes away and I was gone exactly one hour.

Absolutely delicious.  I ordered the chicken and dumpings.  Not exactly what I was expecting... but soooo much better.  The chicken was perfectly roasted  and seasoned.  Tasty gnocchi and vegetables. Great service, but not overbearing.  Highly recommend.

The location is in a good place on South Blvd.  The bar area is warm and has a good feel.  The service was good.  They could have a few more local beers that they cary.  The chicken sandwich was good too.  Nothing bad to say here, nothing great to say either.

Food - 2/2 *I got the South Crunch burger and it was amazing.  A 1/2 burger with pimento cheese, jjalapeno bacon, onions, and hand-cut chips on the burger!  Wow.  Portions are very generous.  Service - 1/1 *No complaints  Price - 1/1 *$10-15, what you'd expect  Atmosphere - 1/1 *Sat out on the patio for Sunday brunch and it was really nice.  Have to be honest, went to the area trying to go the Tupelo Honey Cafe and the wait was too long for 2 little kids and so we ended up at The Liberty.  We were pleasantly surprised.  This is a really good place that we really enjoyed.  I'd go back!

I must say I was pretty disappointed in my visit to The Liberty in Blakeney. I had been to the one off South Blvd a few times and recalled a nice restaurant with really good pretzels and fries and decent sandwiches.  To start, the place is super loud (the restaurant wasn't even full)....I felt like I was yelling just to read my child (who was sitting in my lap) a book; talking to my husband across the table was almost impossible.  Our food was mediocre at best..... If it wasn't for the toppings on my chicken sandwich, my sandwich would have had no taste at all. The French fries tasted like freezer fries with a little parmesan cheese sprinkled on them.  My husband ordered the lamb burger and was also disappointed in it's taste.  Drinks were finally refilled at the end of the meal.  I feel like the chefs are more worried about presentation of food than it's taste. Meals are served on wooden boards that don't provide a whole lot of room for anything but picking up your burger and placing it in your mouth.       On a positive, they have created a book corner in the restaurant with children's books for kids to look at while enjoying their meals. (I did feel that at almost $7 , kids meals were on the pricey side).     I don't think we will be returning to the Liberty anytime soon.

Their sign boasting "Charlotte's Best Burgers" got me to come back to this place and see for myself!  Skeptical about this claim, even though they probably did win some kind of contest, I rarely trust contest results!   Menu : It is kinda cool when a place offers more than one item that peaks my interest and if they are Bold to say they have the "Best" it is a bonus when you can order one fairly plain!  The Burger with Bacon sounded good yet for my first Burger here I want it the way I would get a Burger at a friends (you know what I mean) backyard cookout!  Simple : : Burger, Bun... Tomato (if available if not no problem) and If I am confident and if they have any, a little Red Onion is nice, maybe some ketchup, though I'm very happy with a GREAT Tasting Burger by itself with No bun or any toppings!  Five yelp stars for the Burger! Perfectly Cooked! Simple Seasoning (nothing fancy) GREAT Tasting Ground Beef Burger! Very good Bun! Perfect Thin Sliced Red Onion!  Is this the Best Burger in Charlotte?  So far I will say it is a Very good contender and I will be eating more Burgers, including more Burgers here!  Five yelp stars for the Fries!!!  Glad to have another entry to my Lonely Fries list on yelp!  These Fries are [wait a minute]  Hold on, I forgot to ask you... YOU reading my review, I do not want to embarrass you so instead of asking I'll approach this with the assumption that YOU already know how to order Fries! !! !!!  Yes that is a BIG assumption, though I would rather me be the one who is embarrassed NOT you!  My waitress assured me they could cook they how I requested them... Still that does not insure the flavor will be good, it could help though!  These Fries were great even though they had NO Salt, No Seasoning (I ordered them without the Parmesan cheese they are usually prepared with) they were barely warm and still had EXCELLENT Flavor!!!  Here is the EXTRA, the Plus on these fries are I only ate a few in the Restaurant, I ate the rest at home, at room temperature and they still beat most hot fries!  You could ASK if they would cook your serving of Fries "to Order", then tell them what you would like (unless they say no or just stare at you like you have only been reading Rod0 on yelp).  What do you want???  I order mine "light" meaning not real crisp and not brown.  These Fries reminded me of the Fries at Mezza (Lebanese Restaurant in Columbia, SC).  If you think it is cheating to Fry Potato Strips in Goat Fat (I really do not know what they use to cook these).   It is easy to make my so called Pretzel list entitled "&Twisted&" (I think).  Only the Best Fries make my Lonely Fries list yet for a Pretzel it is an automatic addition!  These are made fresh, mine tasted like it just came out of a real oven (not microwave).  A little Salt!  Nice and soft yet not doughy. I ordered the tower of them (5) and took photos!  These Pretzels were good or a little better than good, maybe 3.5 yelp stars.  Service gets five yelp stars, because they were good, treated me like a KING and were honest about the fact that the Chips are NOT Made-to-order (made earlier and reheated) which only means I do not want them on this visit!  Next time I may check them out because they still might be good!  Today I sat outside.  This is a comfortable and nice looking Patio, end facing South Blvd.  The Decor of the inside is better looking than many places especially if you do not study it too closely!  I was surprised to get the extra attention (usually I get none, taking photos of food at my table)!  Two extra staff members stopped by to ask "does everything LOOK Good"... I almost laughed, yet was glad for the attention to detail.  Does anyone want dessert?  Great thing about "The Liberty" is they are still changing the desserts...  My suggestion is keep working on it!  We want Dessert if it is something that is Great and somewhat unique, even if we have eaten enough for two days in one meal!

Came here for my birthday dinner strictly based on the fact they're the only restaurant I could find in Charlotte that serves poutine! I tried the kind with short ribs and it was delicious! For dinner I ordered the Crunch burger and my husband ordered the bangers and mash. My burger was delicious (still craving it!) and my husband really enjoyed his food as well. We willd definitely be back!

After thinking about things review, I have decided overall The Liberty should receive between a 3.5-4.0 review. Upon entering, I was luckily seated immediately without reservations. I was waiting on a friend who unfortunately was stuck in traffic, so I ordered some coffee and let my server know. Unfortunately, the server took that as she could leave me alone until my friend showed up sans coffee. I reminded her about the coffee and she seemed a little put off. Once my friend arrived, the server was on top of it and knowledgable about the food menu. I had the marinated chicken sandwich while my friend ordered one of the signature burgers. Both arrived fast and were definitely worth recommending. However, once the food arrived, my server was gone again for 20 minutes. Our waters and coffee were empty for at least 15 minutes while servers walked past and said nothing. The food was great, the server was nice, but service overall could be worked on.

The girlfriend took me here to celebrate my 30th birthday on a Monday night.  We had a beer, a cocktail, a burger, a beet salad, and the calamari fries appetizer.  The fries were probably the most interesting - strips of chewy calamari fried and served looking like French fries.  The burger was good, as were the fries (though they could have used more rosemary).  The beet salad was disappointing - arugula was bitter, and beets were not plentiful.  Pumpkin beer was nice, and my girlfriend thought the cocktail was great (fruity but not too sweet).  Would recommend this place for the food and drinks!  Would have gotten five stars if not for the beet salad... ;-/  Service was fine on a Monday night, but there was only one other couple in the restaurant so hard to definitively say how service would be on a busy night.

I'm doling out a lot of 4 and 5 star reviews lately.  What can I say, tis the season.  Just kidding.  the Liberty is a solid 4.5.  I never rate a restaurant as perfect based on one visit.  We went their recently for lunch.  It.was.fabulous.  First I appreciate a good, fresh iced tea (unsweet).  Theirs was the bomb. I had three glasses.  Freshly brewed.  Yum.  My dining partner had the brunch poutine.  It was good, though I only had a taste - she raved.  I was too busy with my fish and chips.  It was greasy, but in a crispy greasy way.  Not a bad greasy way.  The fries were delicious as was the beer battered fish.  The coleslaw, men, not my fav.  But you literally only get a thimble full so who cares.  The fish was the star.  I'll be back.  There's so many good things on the menu I wanna try.

I give them a 5 Star rating because of the Pub Berger and the service.  The atmosphere is very nice as well, perfect for a good business lunch or relaxed diner.  I can highly recommend to both locals and visitors.

I had come through Charlotte in Jan 2012 and had eaten their brunch here. I thought it was fantastic and they put a lot of thought in there menu. It was fried oysters that I remember. They were very good. You pay like 16 to 20 dollars and they bring out a variety of items for you. Very nice! A wide variety of beer on tap too!

Not a good experience. The only good thing was the Poutine Fries and our server. Everything else was terrible. I ordered the Nashville Hot chicken sandwich with Mac and Cheese and it was AWFUL! I expected the chicken to be coated in a dry rub of spices and maybe a little hot sauce but my sandwich was COVERED in hot sauce. Both buns were saturated! It was wayyyyy too much. The Mac and cheese was terrible. It tasted like watered down noodles with some cheese sauce for coloring. I sent back the Mac and cheese (before I tried the sandwich) and felt bad about sending back the sandwich, but I wish I would have because I ended up spending $25 and left hungry. Won't be back!!

I have been to The Liberty many times for lunch and have always been happy with my meal.  Everything from the salads to the burgers to the sides are top notch and unique!  The ambience is very cool -- one wall looks like a giant beer.  It makes me thirsty everytime.  The seats in the main dining room are comfy and I like the high-tops in the bar area.  The wait staff is always helpful and friendly.  There have been a few times that I have received slow service, but not enough to avoid going back.  Parking behind the building is easy -- It can get full fast, though.    They recently revamped their menu with new burgers and sandwiches.  I personally prefer the other menu which had a few non-burger/sandwiches options.  On my most recent visit, I asked the waitress what the most popular item on the new menu was.  She said that their burger was listed as the best burger in Charlotte.  So, I ordered that with macaroni and cheese, of course.  It was a delicious burger but I'm not sure I'd be so bold as to say it was the best burger in Charlotte.  I think it's comparable to a Big Daddy's or even Kick Stand.  I mean, they definitely serve their burgers on a big, fresh bun which is better but the actual burger wasn't spectacular.  I'd order it again, though.    I have also been happy with their dinners and desserts.  But, I've noticed that the dinner portions can (not always) be a little small.  So, if you have a BIG appetite, I recommend an appetizer (and then dessert!).  I've had the salted carmel dessert and it was delicious.  It's a cold dessert but every bite is heaven.  And, they had a cobbler at one point that was the best I've had, but I didn't see it on the menu last time.  It might be worth asking for!!

You come to this place for the "Crunch Burger!" I just wanted to start off with that, so that no one missed it. The Liberty serves an incredible burger, with a good draft beer selection, good service, and a great pub atmosphere. The only downfall to this place is it is a little pricey (as many gastropubs are in Charlotte). If the burgers were a little more reasonably priced, this place would be worthy of five stars.   For those who have trouble finding this place, it is in the same parking lot as Tupelo Honey. It's literally right across the lot. For some reason, I had driven up and down South Boulevard dozens of times without noticing it.   The atmosphere is nice and is fairly typical for a more upscale gastropub. It is somewhat dark and dimly lit giving it kind of an old tavern feel. The wood is dark, exposed and simple. The columns in the main dining area are made of empty kegs, which I thought was kind of a cool touch. They also had live acoustic music in the bar area on the Thursday night that I went.   The Draft beer selection here is very good. They have some selections that you would have trouble finding at other gastropubs. I ordered a Lukcy Basartd by Stone, which is a seasonal by them. I only paid $6, which is not a bad price for a high gravity with upwards of 8% ABV. They also have some hard to find options such as the Enjoy By, but you're probably better off having this at home; it is rather expensive here. It's also worth noting that they were out of several options that they had listed on the menu, but our waitress handled it like a champ and even gave us a free beer. Points for that.   Now to the food. I literally don't see any reason why you should come here and not get the Crunch Burger. It was seriously incredible. Top of the pops of the gourmet burger. We had 6 people at our table and we all ordered the burger, and literally no on walked away disappointed. That's impressive. You can tell that the burger is made with high quality beef. It is so tender and juicy. The Crunch Burger is topped with pimento cheese, jalapeño bacon, onions, and hand cut chips. Check, check, and check. The pimento cheese had a nice moderate spice to it and was extra creamy. The jalapeño bacon added some more spice and along with the chips gave it a nice crunch. This burger is exceptional.   Along with the burger we got the hand cut fries which were exceptional as well. I would definitely ask for their house ranch to dip the fries in. It is a mixture between buttermilk ranch and bleu cheese. Very good with the fries. We also got the poutine as an appetizer for the table. I'm not a huge fan of poutine and had never been that impressed, but this was probably the best I've had.   The Liberty has great food and it is definitely worth a trip just to check out the Crunch Burger. The only downfall is the price. The Crunch Burger is $15 at dinner. If you want to save a couple of bucks, you can go and get the same burger at lunch for $12.50. Either way, it is worth a try. Just fair warning: It's not a cheap place.

If you know me well, you know that I take my burgers seriously. This place has a banner outside naming it as the spot for Charlotte's best burger. And you know what? They're pretty darn good.   I keep it simple as I always do and simply get a good ole fashioned cheeseburger with pepper-jack (I don't like my burgers fussy). I've been here three times and the burgers are consistently good, melt in my mouth, every time. The fries are also quite good....garlic or parmesan....something like that. Can't recall which but nonetheless they are quite tasty.  The last time I went, I opted to get the garlic mashed potatoes in lieu of my beloved fries. Well, they brought me the fries in error. Once I mentioned that I ordered mashed potatoes, they quickly brought them to me, let me keep the fries on the house. Boy am I glad they gave accidentally brought me the fries because the potatoes we bland and boring. Needless to say, those delicious fries didn't stand a chance once I turned away from the potatoes.   As for the vibe, somehow I always catch it when only a handful of people are there. It's relaxed and laid back and I like that it's not a major production. Just chill. Servers are cool too. They're not over the top in that none of them ever try to blow me away, but they are solid when it comes to service.  Good spot. I might just become a regular.

Nothing special about this place. Just another bar with bar food and bar service. Don't expect more than a high bill for food that's not worth the price.  Seems like a good place to drink and watch a game. But that's about it.

Bragged about the food to friends, took boyfriend here with party of 8 for his bday, service was incredibly slow. Our waitress, who was apparently also the bartender, acted like she literally could not care less about us whatsoever, stopping just short of being actively rude. Boyfriend's burger came out raw and cold, and as people who enjoy medium rare, this was still way too much - it practically walked off the plate and was dripping with blood still. They replaced it but still tried to charge us for it. I went to ask to speak to a manager to get it removed and let him know about my disappointment in our overall experience, but I was told he was too busy to talk to me. The hostess directed me back to our waitress/bartender who then said "all you had to do was ask me and I would have removed the burger from the tab"... In what world do I need to ask not to have to pay for a mooing burger after a crappy dining experience overall?? Why doesn't that just happen if you actually want people to come back to your restaurant? I completely understand that there are bad days, but if you don't make an effort to make up for it without my pushing, then I'm not coming back and will be telling everyone else I know not to go to The Liberty. The food may be pretty good, but The minimum wage kids at McDonalds offer better service, and service level is a major part of the dining experience.

I normally don't leave reviews for restaurants that were just okay...but I'm really disappointed with this restaurant.  The food was mediocre, and the prices were ridiculous!  I went with my family for my birthday, and was excited to eat here.  I heard great things about the South End location that recently closed.  What a disappointment this place was!  The food is way overpriced for what it is.  I asked for their house chips instead of the fries that came with my meal (Fish and Chips), and there was a $2.00 upcharge!  Ridiculous!  I understand paying a little more when you ask for a different side...if the ingredients cost more.  But I was asking to swap a potato for a potato.  And they were horrible!  The fish was overbreaded and bland.  My husband had the Sunday Chicken dinner, also bland. The staff was nice enough, but incredibly slow..especially considering there were about a dozen customers total inside the restaurant. I do not recommend this restaurant. Hickory Tavern is much better, and cheaper.

The "All American" breakfast was such a disappointment. The potatoes were covered in a gravy that I'm sure came from a jar, the sausage was undercooked and the grits as well. My kid had a hamburger that was delicious and the service was awesome.

I would have given 4 stars, but service dropped it to 3 stars.   The menu is creative, executed well, and quality is top notch! Service, however, is lacking. We sat at the bar on a Saturday at lunch, and the bartender had 9 tables in the bar area besides us. While the bartender had a great attitude and was friendly, she just couldn't keep up with the needs of her customers. The manager should have recognized this and helped, but just chose to pour the occasional draft beer instead. The food arrived in a timely manner, but the burgers were cold as if they sat in the kitchen for 10 minutes after they were plated.   The Liberty just won best burger in Charlotte and reading the menu is a good indication of why. I like the option of a beef, lamb, or turkey burger paired with creative local ingredients. The house cut parmesan truffle fries were worth the 2 1/2 hr drive alone! The beer selection was very impressive and the decor was pretty cool.   I would like to give them another chance, but it seems that the management needs to polish their skills first.

My family went there on Sunday Mother's Day. We had reservations for 6 people at 7:00 PM.  It was fairly busy, but not jam packed. The server took our order quickly (although she wasn't prepared to tell us what the specials were). 2 side salads and 1 appetizer of pretzels were brought out within 10 minutes. The main dishes, however, weren't served until an over hour later. The server didn't tell us what the problem was, but annoyingly apologized many times. We noticed that several tables were waiting a long time as well. Finally, we demanded to see the manager, who also apologized profusely and told us the food would arrive shortly and he would take care of the bill (which he did). Some of the dishes arrived without the sides ordered and a steak was over cooked, but we ate it because we were extremely hungry.  I may give The Liberty another chance in the future because of prior good experiences, but I hope they can resolve their issues. No one should have to wait 1 hour for a meal once the the order goes in.

My wife Terri and I ate here for the first time on a late Summer evening. We LOVED it. Started out with the house olives. Brine cured and very good. Terri had the pan seared trout. Of course I got to sample hers. It was on a bed of garlic mashed potatoes and green beans. Excellent dish. I had the fish and chips. Light and perfect. The sage fries that came with it were the best fries I have ever had, and that's saying a lot. We will definitely be coming back to this hidden gem!!

Third time at the Liberty and in my experience it's just an average restaurant. The service is okay, nothing to rave about. The decor and design in the dining room is amazing and the atmosphere is very inviting. On the other hand the food is just okay at best. My last visit I had the pickle chips app and the fish and chips. I thought the fried pickles were decent but I've definitely had better fish and chips. Had I known they used Tilapia and not Cod or Haddock I probably would've skipped on this entree. I think the fish may have been frozen or overcooked due to it's texture but the batter was decent however it was very greasy. The fries were solid but I've had better. Nice bar and decent beer selection.
Decor is good. My date got a bottle beer that was a year past it's expiration and my chicken and dumplings came out Luke warm. Not impressed what so ever.

First time here. Ordered the croque monsieur. Sandwich was warm to cool on arrival. Béchamel was close to tasteless. Wouldn't order again. Side salad was blah. Fries were ok, but nothing special. My friend liked her beef brisket sandwich. Other friend found fried chicken dry and over cooked.

I have read some of the negative reviews and I don't quite get it. I have been here a few times (my wife's mosaic art gallery is just a couple blocks away) and my experiences have all been excellent.   The food has always been excellent - from burgers to fish. My college son said the bacon cheeseburger was the best he has ever had. And there is a great choice of beers.   I have also found the wait staff to be very friendly and helpful (great dessert recommendation last night).   Only issues - seating outside has a lot of street noise and it can be a bit pricy out the door.

Last night was my first time to eat at the Liberty.  What a disappointment!! I had the fish and chips-all bread, soggy, no flavor!  I would not even bring it home to my chickens who love fish.  The slaw was soggy and only tasted it as it was so bad.  My husband had a burger-did not eat it but brought it home to the dogs!.  Beautiful place and the wait staff was great!  Not gonna be in business long!

Our first visit to the new Liberty. I had seen some reviews that were not too flattering. So we were a bit apprehensive going in. We love the South Blvd one. The new Liberty  has a concrete and steel look, but thought it was tastefully done. Now the real truth. Started with a beer and cocktail. So far so good.  French dip burger and Scottish salmon entree were excellent. My wife liked the Blakeney's salmon over South Blvd. My burger was perfect and one of the most flavorful I've ever had.  Admittedly it's a bit noisy, but we'll be back. Glad to see Liberty at Blakeney.

We had lunch around 2 pm this Saturday. Ate outside with a couple of other brave souls. Ordered the Kobe brisket with lettuce, tomato and onions on the side. When it was finally delivered, even the Kobe beef and provolone was on the side. Nothing at all on the bun. Strange, but very tasty. My wife had the fried chicken salad that was ok. Had to wait quite a while for our food. A so so overall experience.

The service was AWESOME, they manage a party of 30+ with ease and politeness, all smiles from the management to waitress, if they made mistake with your order or if it was delayed, they took care of it asap and with a smile. My glass was never empty, I never had to ask for refills, our waitress was on the ball from taking the orders, checking on her guest, You name it; she had it under control. Very knowledgeable of the food selections and she provided her personal opinion of the selections made!!! Hands down the best service I've had in a while, i will go back.  Thank you  12/29/17 party of 30

Yum yum gimme some!  Delicious cocktails,  tasty food.... I'm all over it!  I really enjoyed this restaurant.  The service was a bit odd at first(the server wasn't really sure if she had our table or not and wasn't interested in serving us until she was sure but once she figured it out it was all good).  Thing to know:  if you are meeting people there and want to be on time GET THERE EARLY.... THE PARKING SITUATION SUCKS!  The lot is shared with a few other businesses and it gets pretty packed during brunch and dinner hours. Back to the food and drink: I had the brisket Benedict which was delicious!!  The brisket was a bit fatty but delicious all the same.  The cocktails were tasty and well priced which is always a plus in my book.  I enjoyed the warehouse pub vibe Liberty was serving.  It was welcoming and I would definitely come back

Went here again on an incredibly rainy day with my wife - we had a rare "kid free" day and wanted a place in the South End to eat.   We came in around noon and literally the place was almost empty - ended up sitting on the bar side because I wanted the fireplace nearby. Strangely the bar side has a really "cold" vibe because of the metal chairs and hard floor. Took us a while to warm up but the tasty beers helped. :)  I ordered the tomato soup with popcorn and the fish and chips - yes, it's a stereotype, but I love fish and chips and had heard good things. My wife ordered the turkey burger with mushrooms and onions with a side of their legendary mac and cheese.   Soup: No problems at all. Warm, full-flavored, and with good tomoato chunks.  Fish and Chips: The chips rock - natural cut, delicately fried and salted well. The fish was really crispy (probably a beer batter) Turkey Burger: Here was the surprise - it was huge!! Very tasty burger and enormous, both in width and height. This thing was big enough to feed two AND it was very juicy (especially for a turkey burger).  Mac and Cheese: G-R-E-A-T as usual.   Service was solid. Overall I really like the Liberty and hope it continues to thrive.

I love the liberty. Its only a few blocks away from me, and my boyfriend and I almost always default to this restaurant for date night. The menu changes seasonally, but has yet to disappoint. The calamari fries are absolutely killer, and the slaw on the side is almost as good. I dream, read it, dream about the salted caramel budino. It's this decandent creamy cookie dessert on a mason jar and it tastes like a little pillow of heaven. Service is hit or miss, but the bartenders are always attentive and friendly.   Also they have poutine. What.

I tried The Liberty for the first time Labor Day weekend. My friend and I arrived for our reservation and were immediately seated. It was a Saturday evening at 6:00 p.m. and the place was pretty sparse.  Our waitress (Andrea - I believe was her name) was friendly and very willing to explain menu and beer options. She even brought out a mini sampler of beer so I could better make my decision. I ordered the liberty burger (medium) and fries. The first thought I had when my burger came out was how photogenic it looked. The bread was lightly buttered and it seemed somewhat larger than your typical burger-joint burger. The burger came with a pickle on the side and the fries were nicely seasoned.  We decided to go for dessert, I ordered the berry cobbler which came with vanilla ice cream. It was a delicious summer treat. In all, the meal was good but nothing special.

I hate to say it, but The Liberty is losing (has lost?) its touch. This used to be our go-to place for rare and hard-to-get beers, and we even attended an awesome, exclusive Goose Island beer dinner in their private dining room a couple of years ago, but after our last few visits, we've been seriously underwhelmed. Our most recent visit was on a Saturday evening at 6 pm, and we were literally the only people in the bar. The visit before that, they were releasing the 2015 Goose Island Bourbon County Stout on tap the same night as a South End bar crawl and marketing to both crowds - it doesn't gel. Either be a place for beer geeks and have a strong beer list (and do more of those awesome beer dinners) or market to the people who just wanna get drunk, and sell cheap beer.  I feel like The Liberty doesn't know its audience anymore and it's getting trumped by the numerous breweries and new restaurants in South End. Their burgers are still the best in town, but it's time for The Liberty to step up its game and figure out what it wants to be.

Super unimpressed!  I decided to drop in with a friend for a bite to eat after we were done shopping in the area. I had always wanted to try the location in Southend and never got a chance to do so before it closed down.  I ordered a burger and a house salad and my friend ordered wings and fries. Food was mediocre at best. Nothing special.  The service was poor and inattentive.   The issue presented itself when my burger came out. I looked and saw what was obviously a blonde curly hair. I grabbed it and placed it in top of the burger. I was REALLY hoping that it wasn't a hair because I was starving but indeed it was. I informed the food runner that I would like to have a new burger made due to me finding a hair in my current one (which he seemed to be surprised by). He took it back to the kitchen and then made a point to come out and let me know that the chef wanted me informed that it was not hair that I had seen but that it was cheese.  I informed the food runner that I was in no way interested in debating on if there was hair or not in the food that I (and no one else) was expected to eat. I had seen and inspected it with my own eyes 60 seconds beforehand!! My "new" burger came out about 10 minutes later accompanied by the food runner and a separate plate where the chef had taken it upon himself to construct a "cheese string demo" in an attempt to further demonstrate his narrative that I had not had hair in my food but a cheese string.  Are you serious???  As far as I'm concerned, cheese doesn't have a distinct curl pattern or blow wispily in the wind when picked up. I was really taken aback that the chef was STILL pressing the issue. At no point did a  manager EVER come over and address the issue nor did the chef ever come out and address me directly.  The only reason I didn't give this place a 1 Star rating, was because my server (Jack) did take it upon himself to take 50% off of the price of my burger at the end of service even though all of interactions surrounding the matter had been with the food runner and not my server.  I definitely won't be back....there is entirely TOO much competition in town for a mediocre burger joint with poor service to last long. No thanks.

I would give this a 2 but the service was decent and my gripe is.more about the menu. Their menu boils down to a few overpriced burgers or about 5 other entrees that don't exactly scream I want you. To me the menu was too limited and I could find better selection and value elsewhere like Bad Daddy's if I want a burger.   Probably won't be returning.

We've established that I love burgers.  Therefore, it is to be expected that the Liberty, which routinely claims to have the best burger in Charlotte award (from whom, I don't quite know), has been on my to-try list for quite a while.  We were in the area for dinner last night, and so we popped in.  The inside of the restaurant is a relatively cool space.  There's a spacious bar room, which would be a good place to have a few drinks without feeling packed in.  The dining room is comfortable as well, and is decorated with beer kegs, beer quotes, etc.  However neat the decor was, we came for the food.  And we weren't disappointed.  I was excited to see poutine on the appetizer menu, since I've wanted to try this Canadian specialty from the moment I first became aware of its existence.  I wasn't disappointed.  The porcini gravy on the fries was especially delicious.  The burger was pretty dang good, too.  Was in the best in Charlotte?  Well, maybe.  I reserve my full commitment because, while the meat was perfectly seasoned and cooked, and the toppings were thoughtfully selected, the bun was a little on the minimalistic side.  I actually had to finish it with a knife and fork.  Now, a burger with too much bread is a sad thing, but the Liberty has gone too far in the other direction.  Mind you, this is a minor quibble.  iIf you go here, get the burger.  It's dang tasty.  Just be prepared for messiness.  I see some people have complained about the service, but our waitress was fine.  She wasn't super bubbly, but she was polite and kept our drinks filled.  What else can you ask for?

My husband says 5 stars and I say 2 stars, so we compromised at 3.  My husband really liked the food.  It was interesting and tasty.  I thought it was way too pretentious and the food was okay.  I don't like going to places where I feel like the hostesses (and there appeared to be three) look down on you.  If it wasn't for the overall "feel" of the place, I'd give it 4 stars.

I sampled many things at the Liberty and felt like I could finally add my review. I like the oddly paired sausage plate with chutney, warm pimento cheese, and crackers. I honestly just want the pimento cheese and crackers, but that's not an option. It's just so creamy and cheesy. Their burgers are definitely the best thing on the menu. They're huge and flavorful. I've had the pig burger, the crunch burger, and the lamb burger. Enjoyed all of them. The pork chops are thick and cooked well, but a tad under seasoned. The side of bacon mac n cheese is too die for! And we always finish with a dessert. They're all excellent, but I could kill for the creme brulee cheesecake.  I wish the patio was bigger because I find the lighting inside to be weird. Otherwise the decor is pretty cool. Lots of unique beer advertisements. The bartenders are always nice, and the servers are pleasant enough.
Stumbled into this place and really enjoyed it.  We both had burgers and they were quite good.  Nice beer selection.
First time there no complaints... blue cheese house made potato chips burger + parm fries all great! Will be back for more!

Service was great this time.  Burgers were good, w a decent amount of quality toppings.  They actually had the beer on tap that was on the menu (often not so on other visits).   Acoustics are still terrible here!  Got to do something about that.

I had lunch here for the first time and was glad I chose NOT listen to a few of the negative reviews.  Cool atmosphere and our service was great.  If you have a taste for an excellent burger, I HIGHLY recommend The Liberty.  By far, one of the best burgers in town!  Fresh-cut fries and slaw are also over the top.

We visited The Liberty for Sunday brunch. We had wanted to try it out for some time, but the regular lunch & dinner menu didn't seem to have many vegetarian options. So, visiting for brunch was a great way to go. Although the brunch menu was somewhat small, there were many creative options. The service was good - three out of four of us asked for alterations/substitutions & our server & the kitchen were very accommodating, which was greatly appreciated. The coffee was excellent. Our only real concern was that three of us received our food at the same time & it took over five minutes for the fourth dish to come out of the kitchen. We had to ask for someone to check on it. Each of us enjoyed our meals (3 omelette orders & one southern gentleman order). It can be tough to get a Sunday brunch reservation in Charlotte. The Liberty is a good option (really nice atmosphere, cool lighting & decor) when the most popular brunch spots are all booked up!

If I was rating on ambience alone this would easily be a five star. However, I have to take into account the food too.  I had been hearing for months how good The Liberty was and that its burger and fries had won local awards so I went in with high expectations.  The menu looked really good but I am a big fan of first ordering what a place is known for so I got that burger and fries. We also ordered a pretzel tower to get us started. The pretzels were delicious and well worth it for some pre-dinner chomping or if you want to just get a few beers and something cheaper to munch on. They also have a great beer selection with a few things I had never even heard of and their own beer brewed specifically for them.  The burger was huge in that it was stacked high with toppings. I am not sure how they feasibly expect someone to fit that thing in their mouth but they do. And I did. It was actually very very good. I don't think it is the best burger I've ever had and perhaps not even the best in Charlotte but it was delicious. It was a little expensive for what it was though.  The fries were another story. I like my fries crispy especially when seasoned unless they are thick cut. These were thin cut and soggy. Then they were crammed into a cup. I only had a few but I know I've had better in Charlotte and think they somehow must have stacked the voting deck on their award or our table just got a bad batch. They also give far too many (just below Five Guys proportions).  I think they could come down on price by giving less fries and a slightly smaller burger which would allow me to budget more for a few of their tasty brews.  As it is, I wouldn't say no to going back, especially to try a few more items and soak up the atmosphere and great beers. But, I think the food (based on my experience) was given too much hype.

About a year ago, after a few visits with exceptionally bad service, I said I would never go back to The Liberty after being offered a dirty to-go box for my leftovers. When I requested an unused box, the waitress informed me that she couldn't find any boxes and that, yes, there had been food in the box that was offered to me, but that was the best she could do. I was appalled. I myself work in the industry and would be fired on the spot if I had the audacity to do such a thing.   The other night, I decided to give The Liberty another shot when my friends suggested meeting there for dinner. The dinner was poorly prepared and sloppy. The service was mediocre, but none of these things would prompt me to write a bad review. I checked my bank account a few days after the dinner, and noticed I had been double charged.  To me, this is not a big deal... I understand accidents are made. I called and requested a manager twice, but he was never in. (apparently, he is only there 3 hours a day) I was asked to leave a message the second time, but the girl on the phone informed me that "there was probably nothing they could do if i didn't have my ticket number." Tactless. I told her I'm sure they could find a way to refund my money and to please have the manager return my call. After a day or so, the manager did return my call. The server had accidentally swiped my card for my bill and the bill of my friend. I understand that this happens, but wanted the part of the bill that was not mine to be refunded. He asked me to have my friend call in with a credit card payment for her part of the bill. After being in the restaurant industry for 6 years, I have never heard of such a thing. A week after we had dinner there, the manager wanted me to correct a mistake of one of his employees after I was double charged? I was infuriated at how tasteless and unprofessional his request was. He obviously wanted to get off the phone and had no interest in apologizing or compensating for the bad experiences I have had in his restaurant. I looked online for someone else to speak to but unfortunately he IS the higher-up. I was disappointed with the employees that I spoke to and the managers lack of tact. It was extremely unprofessional. If I could give this restaurant a rating lesser than one star, I would.  *** I just received a credit in my account from The Liberty, but instead of refunding my full $39, he decided to return $33. I think it may be worth the $6 to never have to deal with the manager again.
Burgers are to die for! Love the vibe.

Five of us went to The Liberty tonight for dinner.  We had a salmon burger, a couple of chicken sandwiches, a lamb burger and a French fry/salad.  We started our meals with a couple of pretzels.  Everything was very good.  Service was good.

We took a small group from the office as a farewell to a exiting co-worker.   The food from the appetizer to main  luncheon course was awesome.  All of our group were more than satisfied.   I will have to bring my family here sometime soon!  Yummy.

What a pleasant surprise! My wife and I found this gem while running errands. I ordered the Turkey Burger with a side salad.  My wife went for a huge cheeseburger and fries. It was superb.  A great match of quality and uncanny seasoning. The staff was friendly and very attentive.  Am counting the days until we can do this all over again. (If you are going for dinner and can't get there before 7 pm, call ahead for a table.)

Wide selection of good beers. Lukewarm coffee. Mac n cheese came out watery, but crunch burger was amazeballs! Replacement side (baked beans) also very tasty & well spiced. Stick with their strengths and it's a great place to eat.
Been here three times already and love the food.  The duck on the appetizer menu is unreal and the BEST burger in the city.  Atmosphere is cool and staff is friendly.
Their calamari fries and cocktails were simply mouthwatering. Casual vibe. Great place to pregame a night out or just destress after a busy workday/week!
Saturday night and it was dead in this place. Our giant bar crawl group managed to fill the space, but the wait staff wasn't very helpful. Nothing special here, definitely a one shot place.

I have only had the burgers here and they are great!  They brag that they are the best burger in Charlotte and I have to say I am having trouble finding a better one.    Liberty is located right on South Blvd in Southend right near Pewter Rose.  Parking is a little tight depending on the night.  The Carolina burger is my favorite here!  Everything from the bun to the toppings to the size of the whole thing is totally up my alley!  I had to smoosh mine a bit and cut it in half to eat it because it was so big.  All of the ingredients were super fresh and made a great combination.    The only downside I have to the place is the fries.  Everyone likes different kinds of fries - I like the traditional type, sorry to say like McDonalds-ish.  Not too big and just the right amount of salty.  The fries at Liberty are gourmet or something - seasoned to the hilt and mucho pungent.  It isn't my preference but I know some folks love this kind.  We have never had a bad experience with service here - everyone is super friendly and accommodating.  The bar area has booths and high tops but there is also a proper restaurant.  The decor is very warm and cozy with great art work and gorgeous chandeliers.  Check out the one above you when you first walk in!  You will be craving some suds!  :-D

I really love this menu because it's all very natural, much of it locally sourced- very clean, scratch, comfort food. We got the shoo mercy pancake and it was delicious! Our server William was very nice and helpful. We will certainly be back

I've been here several times since they opened.  always thought it was so so until the other night when i had the pub burger.  definitely one of the best burgers in town.  burger was perfectly cooked, had great grilled flavor, fantastic brioche bun..simply the best.  fries were also very good with the parm cheese i like sitting the bar area much better than the dinning room- tons of tables in the bar.  solid beer menu- lots of local brews

If I could give The Liberty 4.5 stars, I would.    This is a great concept with excellent follow through.  The Gastropub concept is an interesting one...upscale "pub food" with extensive beer offerings.  The Liberty delivers on both.  Even though it's a casual restaurant and pub, you can make reservations.  We did and my friends and I sat in the dining room portion of the joint.  Good choice for having conversations.  The menu is simple and doesn't have too many options.  I ordered the Lucky Gastro-Pig...just to say the name really...but, I was so glad I did. It is "Slow-Roasted Black Berkshire Pork Shoulder with Crepes, Pickled Pineapple, Spicy Peanuts, Jalapenos, Lettuce Cups."  No joke, that's what you get.  The pork is in a little Le Creuset pot.  It did need a little salt and pepper, but maybe that's my taste.  It was delicious and I ate every bite.  My friends ordered the burger and fries and the wings.  The fries had Parmesan on them and were amazing.  They were both very pleased with their entrees.  Our server was great...Josh...ask for him.  He was even funny and responsive when my friend pointed out the misspelled menu items which are written all over the walls (example: Chedder for Cheddar, etc...)    My only beef with this place was a couple of things with the decor.  The dull posters with a photo shop picture of beers and a cute poem need to go (see the photos).  They should bring in local art.  It would look great on the walls made of reclaimed wood.  And, they need to take down the cheesy, and misspelled, menu item graphics from the walls.  It makes it look like a "Disney-pub," where you have to explain who you are the customer right away.  This place can (keg) stand on it's own without gimmicks!  The bar was PACKED when we left at 11 pm on a Friday...quite the scene.  I'll be back when I visit Charlotte.

Not sure why this place doesn't have more positive reviews - I love The Liberty! I live nearby and so it's an easy go-to with a variety of choices ranging in price. I love the field green salad with beets and apples, the salmon with farro, the short rib, and, of course, the burgers. The Liberty claims to have the "Best Burger in Charlotte" (even though when the burger has changed since claiming this title), and they do make a pretty dank burger. I love the Lamb Burger. Yes, the burgers and big and messy, but I mean, come on - they're delish.   The waitstaff has always been friendly and helpful. I often split the salad and a burger with a fellow diner, and they bring the burger out already cut in half and the salad split onto two plates for no extra charge. Great beer list, VERY cool atmosphere - this place is great.

I won't go back to The Liberty even if the meal was free.  We had guests in from out of town and wanted to try The Liberty for dinner.  When we walked in, the restaurant side was almost completely empty.  We asked for a table for 6 and was told that they didn't have any openings but we could sit at the bar.  We asked why the restaurant was completely empty and they said they had reservations.  I find it hard to believe that they don't allow for walk ins.  I asked to talk to the manager and the Owner/Manager came out (who was a complete jerk to us) and said I'm not sure what else I can tell you.  If I could give a rating of 0 Stars I would.

Still here, one hour in. Have had one drink, not busy, missing two of the 3 apps we ordered. Service is absolutely dreadful! Just got the bacon popcorn and 2 pretzels that somehow took 25 minutes longer to make than the pig chips and both of them are cold and the popcorn is largely unpopped. Server had no idea what the menu was (pork scratchins in particular). No cocktail menu and beers are taking at least 20-30 min to come out and we have ordered 3 different taps that they are out of. I have been to the southend location many times and was excited to try this location by the house but this is awful. The tiny metal chairs are also bad. We were here for my youngest son and i's birthday and should have given this more time, opening before Christmas seems to have been a HUGE mistake!   I saved this to wait for our mains and the food was fine....if you get the burgers. I ordered the chicken and dumplings and they are really chicken and gnocchi and had an off putting taste. Not to pile onto the server but I never got our Brussel sprouts I ordered, but having tasted my wife's it's just as well, they were soft and mushy.   Someone came and spoke to us as we've now been here for nearly 2 hours and comped our drinks and apps, but the overall experience was a huge letdown. I hope they get it together quickly.

The Liberty is a great place to go for American fare. The Calamari steak fries are awesome (chilies, scallions and curried slaw included). The Pretzel Tower is a must have if you order a beer from their micro brewery. I love the angus burger with cheddar and carmelized onions. They have outdoor seating, which is a plus too.

My wife and I decided to grab a quick bite on lunch since we were taking a break from our tattoo session across the street. We got there and we were told only the bar was open (no big deal) apparently the dinning room is only open between certain hours. But this also means they have a select menu to pick from. My wife and I both got the burgers with fries. It didn't take long for the food to get there. When it came out it looked pretty damn good. I took a big bite and realized that they didn't have mustard on it. To keep from eating a fry burger I asked for some and apparently they don't carry any. WHAT BURGER JOINT DOESN'T CARRY MUSTARD???? I mean come on that's a basic hamburger condiment. Sadly I had to get over it and continue eating it. It was a decent burger, I truly don't see what all the hype is about. The burger in my opinion was a bit over cooked and to top it off the burger is juicy which is a good thing but they don't let them sit when they take them off the grill so as you're eating it you're ending up with a soggy bun and that just sucks. Now the fries, the fries were bomb! I def recommend getting them!  Next time I'm around the area I may eat here again but I'll make sure I'll bring my own mustard. Just crazy! All in all its decent but not mind blowing.

The Liberty seems like one of those places that can be my "safe" place to go when I don't know where else to eat.  The food was decent.  I had a chicken sandwich that was so huge, I couldn't even eat it because it was falling apart.  Flavors were good, but the chicken sandwich was a complete mess.  Fries were good!  The server was nice and helpful, but wasn't around much.  So has anyone ever heard of Blue Cheese Ranch?  Now ranch is more than just a dressing to me...it's a condiment.  I could put it in just about anything.  The Blue Cheese Ranch I had the other day was a little weird.  I definitely wasn't a fan of the flavor combo.  I'm sure there are people would could mix the flavors, but this was the first time I ever asked for a side of ranch and couldn't eat it.  Another first for me was the fact that the restaurant was louder than the bar area!  No problem getting a seat and it was quieter.  They had some live music from a guy that was decent.  Overall, I would say this place is ok.  It's almost like everything was good with the potential to be better, but it just missed the mark.  You're not going to come out saying "OMG that was the best meal ever".  It's a large space, so if you're hungry and you don't know where else to go, you can count on The Liberty.  I've heard good things about their brunch, so I'll have to check that out sometime to see if I have a different experience.

Hostess said we could be seated at the high top table.  We didn't want that.  She said we could sit st the bar.  We didn't want that.  I asked her if we could sit at one of the empty tables outside.  She agreed and sat us.  We looked at the menu and realized it was a fixed menu for Easter.  Why didn't the hostess mention that to us?  And then we waited and waited for s server to come.  Nobody came to wait on us after a long wait.  I saw the sanitation score and it was s 91.5!  Nothing was hitting on any cylinder. So, we got up and removed ourselves from this restaurant.  Won't be back.

Okay Liberty - my name is Michael and I can be shy around new people. When I first saw you, I was peering out the window at Tupelo's. I must admit, you did look kind of snazzy. The next time, I thought we might have a drink together. Your Birdsong Lazybird Brown hair made me sigh. When last we met, I think you sensed my hesitation, there are so many restaurants in Charlotte, and I've been hurt before. Well, let's just say your Crunch Burger has me climbing on tables and dancing in the streets. Woot woot! Throw caution to the wind and run your truffle fry fingers through my hair!!
Fantastic food with a great vibe but they absolutely HAVE to figure out a way to deal with the noise level. You just can't hear the person in front of you. They're aware and working on it though!

This is my second time here for brunch. First time at this location however. Though the staff is really nice; from the hostess, to the server, to the food runners, everything is really slow. I ordered the deviled eggs as a starter and it was supposed to include candied bacon. There was no bacon on top and when I told my server she was happy to top it off however they put regular bacon on top instead of candied bacon. That oversight a side they were pretty good.  For my meal I got the omelette. It's served with breakfast potatoes as a side and generally I substitute because for some reason Charlotte restaurants just cannot get breakfast potatoes right. I'm so glad I was wrong in this case they were amazing! Don't miss them if you come here for brunch! The Omelette was also pretty good. So I wasn't blown away with the food and the service I would certainly come back again and get the same thing.

So we just ate at the The Liberty in Ballantyne and we decided to come to this one due to convenience but SHOCKER they are the same restaurant with 2 totally different menus. WTH!?  The breakfast potatoes I had at The Liberty in Ballantyne where are arguably the best breakfast potatoes I've ever had in Charlotte. Everywhere else just seems to be a hit-or-miss even if the food is great. When I asked the waitress to say we're the same she couldn't tell me. I took a gamble but since the entire menu was different it was safe to assume that the potatoes are different also. I was right. Not only were they not good but they were not even close to the ones that the other location. Nonetheless that was just a side and the main course is actually pretty good.  They offer an omelet of the day and a lobster omelette for $11 was just too good to pass on even though I was torn between this and the Liberty breakfast which comes with both bacon and sausage, eggs potatoes and a biscuit only $12. It's unheard up to get to me for such a low price. Guess I'll get that next time because it does look delicious. This time it was an easy choice because they were out of biscuits and there is no way I'm going to take toast over a biscuit.  Though the food is just average they have a couple other entrees that looks really good and I will come back and try them. Pretty average restaurant overall but worth it for the price.

This is by far my favorite Resturant in town. Some reviews on here have complaints about service and they couldn't be more incorrect. I come here all the time and have never met a employee that wasn't kind, careful, and hardworking. Great people and even better food. Would highly recommend.

Best Burger in Charlotte? Talk about false advertising. Food was mediocre at best. Service was terrible & basically nonexistent. Bathroom was an absolute mess. Place where entire staff merely going through the motions but not actually doing their jobs.

Have always loved The Liberty on South Blvd . Very excited when this one opened up in Blakeney. Got a reservation through Open Table. Excited to see Blackened Shishito Peppers on the Appetizer menu. Huge Serving of them in a great Asian sauce. Also got a plate of Pig Skin Nachos with Pulled Pork, very tasty !       I ordered the Grilled Caesar Salad with Salmon, Two others had the Fish and Chips and My daughter had the Crunch Burger. Even the child's Mac and Cheese was served perfectly with fresh green beans, fries and apples chunks ! Service was good and the food right up to par with South Blvd . Had a couple of Craft Beers and it was a great Friday night ! Glad to have it down in South Charlotte !

Stopped by the other night for a quick dinner for the opening of Restaurant Week, It was great...First you got a mason jar of Boiled Peanuts for the table. Then I had the Bazooka Guac..it was Guacamole with Goat Cheese and Pistachios..Wonderful . Then I had the Hanger Steak with Jalapeno Hollandaise..who ever thought of that ought to win a Prize - it was beyond delicious!~! And how could we go and not get the Salted Caramel Budino!! It is something I dream about ...alot!!   Go now during restaurant week or anytime, their food is consistently good! One of the Best Burgers in all of Charlotte too!!

I've been here a few times and always thought it was "OK"... The burger is delicious I will say.  But I have never been impressed with the staff.  This past weekend my husband and I went with another couple and it was awful.  The hostess was rude, short, not friendly at all.  The restaurant was freezing and when we mentioned that we were told 'oh don't say that it was hot earlier and i feel just fine.'  We had to sit through dinner with our heavy coats on.  Our waitress was constantly rushing us, not helpful or friendly one bit.  At the end my friend (who is pregnant) had to go to the bathroom. She want and they were out of toilet paper so she told the hostess. The hostess sighed and said "well i'll have to go downstairs to find some so you'll have to wait"  Then when she returned she didn't even put the toilet paper on the roll, she just sat it down.  My meal was just ok, I ended up feeling sick afterwards actually I think from the grease.  I am in no hurry to go back. But my husband does love the burger there.

Finally got my turn to try this place out and it was everything I had hoped for.  I loved the interiors of the place as soon as I walked in.  It's literally beer themed with a beer like chandelier and beer glass dividers in the main dining room.  My girlfriend and I sat in the bar and the window seating was great.  For the record I like natural daylight.    I had the Southern Crunch Burger.  Ground beef burger with lettuce, tomato, pimento cheese and house chips on top.  It came to the table with a knife becuase there was no way to fit it all in your mouth.  It was HUGE and delicious.  I can't wait to go back!
Great food and service.  Looking forward to going back. I'm puzzled by the negative reviews.  Our visit was so good!

Was here with group of friends, and I ordered the crunch burger with fries. The service is nice and we had a great time here chill and relax. The burger is kinda big and the fries are good! The taste is good, and I would recommend people try it out. Unique experience!

My favorite burgers in Charlotte, great pub atmosphere and great food!  They change their menu every few months and always have some great burgers on the menu.  Fries and sweet potato fries are also great!  They always have local beers on tap and have a good wine selection as well.  Go with some friends and sit in the bar!

The food was excellent and definitely 5s they have a few kinks to work out with staff; but it was some of the best food I've had...it's new to blakney but will give the other restaurants in the area a run for their money. It seemed pretty family friendly and reasonably priced for the excellent food. The wine list was fairly extensive and the cab we had was very good.... I would recommend making a reservation though. It is worth checking out may be a new favorite.

I keep trying The Liberty in hopes of boosting my opinion of it..... With the same result.  It's just "eh....".  I've been here on pub crawls, beer tastings, business lunches and dinners..... I've had their famous truffle chips, their even more famous burgers, a few appetizers...... And I remain overall un-impressed.  It's not that I don't understand the appeal of the restaurant.  It's in a good location, wide amount of parking, good beer selection, decent service, and ok food.  I just can't overcome my feeling that there isn't anything that special about it.  So I hang on to my "so-so" status on The Liberty, but on the flip side, I do keep trying.

This restaurant is located in the south end area. It's a brewery but they offer cocktail drinks and wine. We came on a weekend night and surprisingly it wasn't crowded. The staff were friendly and attentive. As soon as we came in we were greeted and seated. Since I'm new here I wanted to try several different things. I ordered the pretzels as an app. It probably pairs well with beer. It's very filling made fresh but noting fabulous or different from average freezer pretzel. I got the salmon burger which was tasty but a small portion of meat. It came with iceberg lettuce.... it didn't pair well with the meat. I asked for another option if arugula and it tasted much better, but again it was more in then meat. My sister got the lamb burger and loved it. I tasted it and it was pleasant for my tastebuds. We tried a variety of drinks. The signature drink libertini is a no go. The dragon berry lemonade is sweet and tasted good but if you want strong and good taste the Budino last one on the menu and the Paloma. Literally the Budino is all alcohol. So to wrap this review up it's good to come for drinks. Try the recommended food maybe the other options aren't listed for a reason on peoples reviews or they had a few cocktails so things taste different. Hope this helps in your decision.

This review is 100% reflective of the service, not the food. The food was fine, though not anything to write home about. We got passed around between servers when we were sat until we finally wound up seated with Hannah. Our son ordered macaroni and cheese (his favorite!) and it came out and was disgusting and borderline inedible. I called Hannah over and politely asked to send the uneaten food back and get a hamburger for my child instead, and I was greeted with a rude look and silence as she snatched away the plate. She was rude and nasty to us the rest of the night, and even worse, she left the macaroni and cheese on the check. We spent a good amount of money tonight and I'm really disappointed in the way Hannah treated us. Absolutely will not be returning, and I'll let my friends and family know not to as well.

Went there for the first time burger was well done even though ordered medium and the people I came with said that McDonald's has better chicken sandwiches and fries then this place. The fries were not bad just soggy. Overall they need to learn how to make burgers from Cowbell or Chilis. Yes Chilis even they have much better tasting food.

This was one of them eat brunches we've had in Charlotte. The Farmers market omelet was fresh and cooked to perfection!  The mimosa and bloody Mary's were great as well. Service was friendly and attentive. No wait and so much better than where we originally planned to go!  This is now on our top go to list!
I heard on the local news today(5-10-18), that The Liberty closed unexpectedly. Something to do with the owners business partner passing away recently!

This is my second time visiting The Liberty and it was even better the second time. I ordered the Duck Confit Poutine, Steak Frites and Peaches and Cream Cheesecake as well as a Queen City Whiskey Cocktail. I don't know what to say other than great, excellent, exceptional. The only trouble I had was deciding on what to order. I would still like to try the Dagwood Burger, Chicken and Waffles, Southern Fried Trout and their Pretzels, so Ill probably be going back a few times at least.

Checked this place out for Sunday brunch for the first time! They have $3 mimosas, which are pretty big pours. We were eating closer to lunchtime and I was craving something healthy, so I ordered one of their salads with salmon on top. The salmon was perfectly cooked and the toppings on the salad were unique and well balanced. It was a super good salad! I also ordered a side of biscuits because I was also craving carbs. They were fine, but nothing special. Everyone loved their food tho, so we will definitely be back and probably also check out dinner.

Irish pub(ish)/American food.  Great burgers (people RAVE about them), constantly changing menu.  Definitely try the devils on horseback & angry mussels!  Do not miss the SALTED CARAMEL BUDINO.  Menu changes often, but if they have pulled pork stuffed hushpuppies, GET THEM.

They get my vote for best burger in Charlotte!  The Pig Burger was incredible.  It is giant though so come hungry.  The Lobster Mac and Cheese was fantastic too.  They had a lot of great wine options also which is always a big plus for us.  The ambiance was great but we did move tables because it was a bit bright for us.  They were super accommodating and moved us to a corner table that allowed us a better spot to cuddle up and enjoy our date.  I can't wait to go back and try more!

My visit to Liberty was brought on by the Charlotte Craft Beer festivities. Liberty was hosting a Founder's tasting event in their basement bar. My dad and I ordered a flight and took our platter of beer to the bar upstairs to order dinner.   He ordered the basic burger that a HUGE with rosemary, parmesan fries. I got the goat cheese, arugula salad which was so fresh.  I also had the bbq hand-ground sausage with pimiento cheese. It was really good but I was a little bewildered as to why my sausage was sauced. In my experience, a good sausage can stand on it's own in most instances.   Overall, a great dining experience and an interesting food selection. I will only mention that I was confused by the set up of the menu, but I will go ahead and attribute that to my simplistic expectations for a menu.

We have wanted to try this place for awhile and have heard they had good burgers, so we gave them a try at lunch this past week. We got there around 1pm and it was crowded said give them 5 min and they would get us sitted. We waited for around 15 min looking at plenty of empty sits, once we got sitted they came right over but took about 10min to gte us a drink.
