The cheese that comes with the pretzels is really good and good selection of beers. We both ordered the burgers...one with fries and one with mac & cheese. Burgers finally come out and was more like well then the med. we had ordered them out , figured they had set waiting to be picked up. Burgers taste was alright but nothing over the top and dont see where they one of the best burgers in Charlotte. Lunch took 1hr 45min, so dont expect to get in and out quick here.

A huge mistake in changing the menu. No more short rib option, so the poutine suffers a immensely. A hugely "dumbed down" menu, probably cost driven, leads to some crucial deletions. They said they could add brisket to the poutine. It was super salty and the brisket was amateurish. Don't do barbecue poorly. Just stop. The beers are still great. They keep a vey diverse tap list here always. We are twice a month patrons. The kid's grilled cheese had gouda...which is probably cool for kids in the know, but stop trying to be impressive. A kid knows what they like and when I order that change needs to be known. The beautifully prepared chicken and dumplings are gone. The mac and cheese is okay. The blackened green beans are kind of fun. They still have the famous crunch burger and some great fish and chips. I had the the sloppy cheese joe and a side salad for entree. It was super good. Overall, though, you have to be more competitive in South End now with places like O-ku popping up. The bar has been raised. I am still disappointed in the menu changes and most likely will not return. Unless I just crave a crunch burger and am far from Cowbell.

It's unfortunate. I really want to love this place!! The first time I went, great food & service. The second time, we arrived 10-15 before they switched over to the limited menu (which I didn't even know it was told about). Instead of taking my order, they waited those 15 min, then told me we could only get off the limited menu now and seemed angry that I was frustrated by it. Had I known that, I wouldn't have waited around 15 minutes (inside the time they SHOULD have served the regular menu) and as I did anyway, go elsewhere! And lastly, I ordered takeout which they did not get right and then offered me a whopping 10% off my total - or drive back for my missing items. Just too many errors and problems with service to want to go back often.

This terrific South End gastropub is renowned for having some of the best burgers and pretzels in Charlotte, and its reputation is well deserved. The pub burgers range from the simple to the outrageous (try the massive 'Crunch' burger, and you won't need to eat again for a week). The beer selection is also excellent, with more than a dozen brews on tap that range from local favorites to obscure labels from across America. The menu also boasts some healthier fare, but why bother when you can order a burger the size of your head?  The family-friendly atmosphere and ample selection of kiddie grub makes this a great spot to bring the family for lunch or dinner, but on the day we visited, the service was disappointingly slow. Nonetheless, The Liberty is a Charlotte institution for a reason, and well worth a visit if you're looking for a good meal in South End.

The first time we went to The Liberty was during Queens Feast in summer 2017 and had a great experience. Got a pork chop dinner and some trout dish, and both were bomb!  We decided to go back recently and was expecting the same type of experience. I guess the menu has changed because the pork chop or trout dishes were not on the menu anymore. In fact, with the exception of 4-5 dishes, all the menu consists of now are mostly burgers and sandwiches. The menu on their website has not been updated to reflect this so it is a bit misleading. This was the first disappointment.   We decided on the late night burger and the famous crunch burger. I don't think it was worth $14 and $15 that we paid for it. The burger was cooked past our liking (medium) and the fries were cold.  I don't think I'll be back to The Liberty unless they are participating in the Queens Feast.

I Came here to celebrate the Queen's Feast, for the first and last time.   The Liberty was picked by my new co-workers, whom I went with. I was the first person to get there, and the rest of my group arrived within 15 minutes.  My biggest issue is that our Waitress wasn't super-attentive. She wasn't rude but when I flagged my issue with her, I wasn't satisfied 100% with the resolution. I specifically asked her to pointed out if I order something contains pork. "The menu is strightforward." She said.  I ordered "Ashley Farm's "Chicken & Waffles" - with roasted drunken peaches, arugula, duck-fat waffle and smoked-maple-bourbon-siracha honey." Thirty minute later, I got my bland waffles topped with bacon!!! Seriously, Liberty ?!! I was hungry, and I had to raised my complaint since I don't eat pork (religious restrictions.) The waitress took my plate and promised to replace it with a new order. Funny enough, she brought out my freshly made chicken & waffles in two minutes. They fried the chicken and baked the waffle in two minutes?! I ended up not eating the chicken, and she said the manager took my drink off the check because the bacon was not mentioned on the menu and it  mistake on their side ( which was nice- I admit!) However, I didn't want a freebie, I want to eat.   And to be fair, the Salted Caramel Budino and Chocolate Scotch were DELICIOUS. Very very V.E.R.Y DELICIOUS!  Two and Half Yelps

Horrible service.  Food is ok.  Sat in bar area at table and even tho not crowded waitress disappeared 3  separate times for no reason.  Then spent time showing another table photos from her phone rather than serving our drinks.  Third time we've had bad service.  Different servers.

Went with the family for dinner and have written reviews before, had to write again since the food and service were much better than in the past few visits. The burgers, wings and chicken Buffalo sandwich were very good. The server was very attentive. It was not very crowded for a Saturday night., so the noise level was not too heavy. I had the mussels which were good, not great and would probably not order them again. Our friends came in and had the shrimp pasta which they really liked and said the portions were a very good size. Our other friend had the trout and he did it was very good .

I would just like to start off by saying that for context of this particular review, my family made reservations through Open Table for Mother's Day about a month in advance in order to ensure we had a place to eat for lunch.  This, in the end, did not matter at all.   Without going into great elaborate detail, I'll just give you the issues we encountered: ·        We were forced to order from an abbreviated menu that required you to spend $30 for an Appetizer, Entrée and a Desert.  This resulted in members of our family that didn't want to order anything at all because there wasn't anything on the menu that they found appetizing or would fit into their dietary requirements.  I will give praise to our server though.  After asking the Chef if he would make anything special for our family member, he refused.  So she asked her friend that happened to be working in the back that day to just make her a simple salad, which he graciously did. ·        Because of the abbreviated menu and cost per person, we all decided to split our meals.  Our server ensured us that splitting our meals would be a fine way to handle the situation and that there would be plenty of food for each of us if we chose to do that.  This would turn out to be completely incorrect. ·        After we ordered our food, we waited for about 35 minutes.  Finally, the kid's meals for our kids came out along with a couple salads.  The salads were not enough to split between two people and so, as a result, only the ladies in our party were able to eat the salads. ·        We waited for another hour for our entrée's.  After repeated apologies from our server, we finally told her that if we didn't receive our food within 2 minutes, we would be forced to leave.  And so, with the snap of a finger, all of our food begins coming out.  The portions we received are barely enough for one person to eat from.  My wife and I along with others that ordered the Salmon, basically had 3 - 4 bites of food each from our entrées and that was it.  The deserts were good, however. ·        After all of this, all that we received for our trouble was an "I'm so very sorry" from our server.  The manager never came out to apologize, the Chef never came out to apologize.  They basically threw the server under the bus and said "handle it" from what we could gather.  I felt very sorry and embarrassed for our server.   No one offered to at least comp some of our meals or try to do something to make it right.  Besides the fact that this was Mother's Day and we had a party of 14 people patronizing this establishment, it was by far the most horrendous dining experience I can ever recall having.  I simply cannot believe it, even a day later.  Just a completely unacceptable outcome that we were dealt.   I've learned today that this owners' other location closed down and this location is the only other one that remains.  I'm not sure why the other closed but if this owner, chef and staff do not get their act together, this location will be closing down very quickly as well.  I can assure you with all the other fine establishments that provide quality food and service in the area, people simply will not put up with a pile of crap like this.

I went to The Liberty in Blakeney on a Friday night.  Two of us tried to order a draught beer. The waitress first presented us with a hand written note card with a list of choices. HAND WRITTEN note card- very unprofessional!   Oh,no, that was the incorrect card.  She then presented a second hand written note card and explained that this was the updated list.  I asked about two beer choices on the list and they were no longer available.  So much for the updated note card!  I ordered an iced tea. My chicken sandwich was fair.  My friends ordered the fish and chips - very skimpy!  One of them asked if she could eat half of my bun that I had placed on the side of my plate after she finished her fish.  A customer is still hungry after the fish and chips platter so she requests to eat a left over half bun on another plate?  Come on people!   Would someone please require the millineal wait staff to reenter training? I left cash to pay my bill.  The waitress took the money, didn't ask if I wanted change back ( I didn't, but one should ALWAYS ask).  Of course she never returned and just assumed the extra money was hers to keep.  Where does this attitude of entitlement come from.  Some one please tell these young waiters/waitresses that this is just not the way it goes.  No, I will no be back.  Don't even consider going to this restaurant.

I've been to the Liberty a couple of times now.  This place has such a FABULOUS selection of beers, and I feel like I'm in beer heaven here.  They have a wonderful selection of both local beers and some great imports, many of which are on tap.  I've had great service both times too.    Their food is fairly good, but I find it a bit overpriced.  It's probably related to the area, since its prices are in line with many of the surrounding restaurants.  The first time here, I had fish and chips.  The portions were large, but the fish was just ok.  The second time I had a shrimp and grits special.  It was pretty good, being more tomato-based, which surprised me.  However, the price was a little steep for the portion size, and it wasn't because of the high number of shrimp (the whole dish had five medium-to-large sized shrimp.  Overall, I love this place and plan to keep going back.

The food was overall pretty good, neat brewery decor, casual atmosphere. Service was pretty poor.  We stumbled in here for brunch because Tupelo Honey across the street had a 2 hour wait (ain't nobody got time for that)  The burgers: all incredible  The brunch food: pretty good, french toast is amazing (egg sandwich comes on a massive greasy bun, if you are into that, thats cool...I like toast)  The service: hostess was more attentive than our server was... the group I was with was really laid back so we didn't mind that all of our orders were mixed up.

We'll be back! My family and I dined here at 10pm after a long day of activities and we were famished. We actually intended to go for Tupelo Honey Cafe right next door but their late night menu was limited. The Liberty was still offering a full menu and they had a lot of different options for everyone in our party, including the kids. We tried a BUNCH of things on the menu but our favorites were the mussels (the spicy tomato broth was so yummy), the salmon (crispy and cooked to perfection), the short ribs (super tender) and the star of the show was the chocolate cake (deliciously decadent). The kids also liked the cheesy poutine with short rib gravy and also the creme brûlée cheesecake. The server was super friendly and attentive, despite the fact that we were the last party of the night.  This place exceeded  our expectations for a last-minute late night family meal!

I recently went there on a business lunch and my colleague and I ordered the fish and chips.  The place got  busy during the time we were there. The fish came with several dipping sauces and was very good.  The french fries were delicious and the cole slaw was also good.  I had dinner at Liberty about a year ago and it was very good then too. The food at Liberty has a distinctive style. It is not the "run of the mill" variety and I will definitely return there.  The service was good but not great. I had to flag the waitress down to get a couple re-fills.  It is a nice  place to enjoy a good meal.

I had a couple friends that live down the road from here so we ended up dropping in for dinner and drinks.  The atmosphere is... comfortable. We were in the bar room and it was a Wednesday which means $5 wine night. The staff were okay- good about service but not too friendly.  I ordered the pear and mixed greens salad and paired it with the Malbec they had. Food was fresh, it looked nice, and I could tell the wine had been opened that day which was good.  Their menu seemed rather put together and their plating for the cheese and meat plate my friend got was nice.  For what you get, I feel like this place is a pinch pricier than it should be but overall I had a nice time.

I stopped by here last week when a girlfriend suggested we meet for drinks one night, I had a yummy wine, a vibrant cab suggested by one of the staff, my friend had champagne.   Due to how late we stopped in on a weeknight; we weren't expecting the place to be as busy as it was, but we still grabbed two seats at the bar.  We had a yummy charcuterie plate and Mara, the bartender was attentive and let us roam between sitting outside on a rare warm night in March and at the bar.  I'm back tonight drinking the wine that Mara remembered I like, the matchstick in case you were wondering.  I was greeted by name and they didn't say a word that I am on a deadline bringing my laptop to the bar:  the Brussel sprouts are served in two different ways, but I stuck with the traditional preparation and wasn't Disappointed, I'd love to try the lobster Mac and cheese but it was such a cold night I wanted some hot soup.  I got a bowl of perfectly seasoned tomato soup which feels more like a bisque, and a yummy croquette with cheese.  The ladies beside me were making out with their burger and poutine, but didn't seem embarrassed. Seriously, this place is yum.   My pics are of half eaten food because I knew nothing of self-control when I sat down tonight. But this will be one of my spots, for sure.  PS, the small cast iron pot that the brussel sprouts were served in is adorable, and I need some for my house.

All around underwhelming.   I visited with a party of 6 on a Thursday night. I originally had a reservation for 12 but half my group flaked out a couple days before. I couldn't change our reservation on Open Table... I had to call to request the change. A bit of an inconvenience.   The restaurant was pretty dead when we arrived at 6:30. There were a few more tables full when we left around 8:30. Service the entire night was sufficient but lacked any personality. Our waiter was soft spoken and didn't seem interested in any small talk.   The food was the most disappointing point of the evening. I ordered the pulled pork grilled cheese sandwich, which came with a cup of chili. The sandwich was not cooked well -- there were grill marks on the top but the bottom slice of bread was untouched/uncooked. The pork was piled into the middle of the sandwich, so in one bite, I unintentionally ate about 3/4 of all the pork there was. Gravest sin of all though, was that the cheese was not even close to melted. It was barely even warm. So, essentially, I had a half-cooked cheese sandwich. Bleh. The chili wasn't much better. Flaming hot as if it has been microwaved and bland.   The Liberty salvages a few stars for their decent beer selection and the basket of pretzels we started with. They were pretty tasty and the mustard that accompanied them was really good!

Best burger in town, period.    It's expensive-ish, parking is a bit of a hassle, but the burger is worth it.  The lamb burger is amazing but I usually go with the pimento cheese one.  I have always felt the wait staff was quick and friendly too.

Great atmosphere and cool decorations. The food was incredible and the service was spot on. I ordered a beer that I didn't really enjoy and the bar tender tossed it and gave me something else. Fish and chips are money! So many different things I want to try, I'll definitely be back.

We came for a lunch while out furniture buying and came here because Tupelo Honey Cafe was a 1 hour wait. Appetizer: hand cut parmesan truffle fries Hubby lunch: bacon cheeseburger with tomato soup  My lunch: grilled chicken cobb salad Desserts: Pecan Bread Pudding (me)                  Butterscotch Pudding (him)  Fries were delish, bacon cheeseburger was good but just a bacon cheeseburger with a really really good bun, tomato soup above average (his opinion not mine as I didn't like it at all) Chicken Cobb was above average/ delish - thank goodness I ordered dressing on the side and I suggest you do the same as they put a lemon vinaigrette and a buttermilk ranch on it and it would've been too much for me, hubby got the caramel pudding which was good but super sweet and I got the pecan bread pudding which was perfect!  Overall I'd say that if you want a burger- sandwich or salad this is pretty good but I only gave it 3.5 stars because the food wasn't exceptional and the service was pretty bad.

Last night was our first time at The Liberty and definitely left us wanting to come back!   The beer menu is very inviting and I sat there wondering if there was a way to work my way down the list to try every beer...this might be a fun new goal of mine.   My date ordered the Braised Short Rib and it was awesome...I definitely found myself wishing I had made the same selection. I ordered the blue cheese ribeye, which was just ok...the meat was pretty chewy and tough, but the flavor was ok. Not bad, just not what I was hoping for. On another good note our server at dinner was extremely sweet and really did a wonderful job, which is important to us because we have definitely not returned to restaurants in the past no matter how good the food is if the service sucks.   After dinner we moved to the bar area where we were excited to find live music...apparently they do it every Thursday night, which we had no idea about! The guitarist was REALLY good and definitely made us want to come back just to listen to him!   All around our first visit went well and we are definitely looking forward to returning and enjoying more live music on Thursday nights in the future!

we drove over specifically to go to Liberty. It was close to 2pm. So the lunch rush was gone, but the floors were so filthy and there was so much trash under the outside tables, that we ate across the street. The dirt was a huge turn off...

Great atmosphere: sitting outside where there's fantastic live music, got a great beer from Appalachian, and the pretzels and beer cheese are good eats, and the service staff is super friendly. Highly recommend.

OK. I think the Liberty was a lot better a few years ago. I'm unsure what happened. The BBQ is dry now. It just isn't the same.   HOWEVER, the poutine is amazing (can we please go back to the duck poutine?) They have a solidly good brunch. Their hamburgers are rated the best consistently.  I have had some truly awful service here. Of course, I'm a sucker and I come back. They do need to work on that.   They have the whole never ending mimosa thing. Skip it.
Well designed gastro.  Prompt, courteous service.  Unique, quality dishes at a reasonable price. Diverse tap selection for the geek and novice alike.

I went here after work for a drive no and some food. I sat at the bar and the waitress who took care of me was very nice. She left halfway through my stay and was replaced by a male bartender. He was very rude to me and other patrons. He seemed almost aggravated to be there. At one point I asked him a question and he gave me a dirty look and just turned away. The food I had was good and the other employees seemed nice but this guy was so awful he ruined the experience for me and some other customers. It's a shame, I really liked their other location.

This place was delicious and our waitress was fantastic! We were pretty hung over when we came here, and I have to admit it definitely helped. I got the mini chicken biscuits and my husband got a burger and we got poutine for an appetizer, everything was seasoned and perfectly cooked! The only complaint I have is that it didn't seem very clean, our table was a bit sticky and this pesky fly would not leave us alone. We came in at a weird time, 3:00pm, so there was no reason why our table shouldn't be clean. Other than that, highly recommend!
Come by a few times and haven't been disappointed.  Beer, pretzel and burger.....what more can you ask for.

The Liberty is always a great place to go. I prefer it as a dinner spot. The ambience is semi-casual to laid back. They are known for their burgers. I prefer the pimento cheese and bacon burger! Mind you, these are HUGE burgers, prepare to be stuffed afterwards! Staff is also very friendly and helpful with the menu. Good beers on tap as well. They received four stars because I diverted away from the burger the last time I went and got the Butcher's steak. I was disappointed in the steak itself and the way my fries, salad, and steak were piled on top of each other in an oblong bowl. It made my fries soggy and I was expecting more salad.

If you are thinking about a private dinner party, look elsewhere.  We had a rehearsal dinner here and were far from satisfied.  Be sure you understand what you're getting.  Staff is somewhat unable to communicate the same information.  We were never told to give them an exact number of diners, but were charged for the number our kids gave when asked for an estimate of how many there would be.  Tip, tax and entire meal plus appetizers for 4 that didn't show.  Poor business practice.  They had one server to take our order.  That took 20 minutes.  The highlight of the evening was a video of our kids and the server decides that's a good time to clear the table.  Poor judgement.  Too late for us, but not for you. Shop around.

I had heard some good and bad things about The Liberty, so we finally decided to drop in and try it out for ourselves to see what all the noise was about. The décor was very cool and I like the fact that the menu constantly changes so they can use fresh ingredients. A short overview of our visit on a Saturday evening:   The good: definitely get the house-made fresh pretzel. It was delicious and the cheddar fondue amazing. The chicken and dumplings were also very good.   The bad: the service and parking. The restaurant wasn't busy (there was no wait), but our service was abysmal. I'd read that on multiple reviews and now know it to be true. The parking was also quite difficult on a Saturday.    That said, we might be back for drinks and the fresh pretzel in the bar area, but will probably skip the full dinner due to the service.

Made the mistake of ordering the BBQ platter. A scoop of cheap pulled pork, a quarter slab of ribs, and some chewy brisket... All of it smothered in the worst BBQ sauce I've ever had. Very thick, very tangy, heavily poured over every inch of the trio of meats. $11 for this travesty on a plate. Pretty unattentive server who made us wait 15 minutes for the check. Fairly small menu to begin with, mostly burgers. Not a huge deal, but I would have expected more options overall. Maybe I just made a terrible choice and should've just chosen a burger, which I think perhaps the place is known for.

The Liberty is a great place for a gourmet burger. We walked up from our house a few weeks ago after hearing about this burger's fame. The funny thing is that The Liberty did not set out to have the greatest burger but after being recognized for their burgers by The Charlotte Observer, the self-described gastropub has embraced the public's love of their burger. We tried both the traditional pub burger and the Kobe beef burger on our visit. Both were fantastic. So were the fried pickles - definitely the best fried pickles I have had. I also adored the salted caramel budino - like pudding but even better. I look forward to returning to The Liberty soon, both for more burgers and to try some of the other enticing offerings. I've heard great things about the house made soft pretzels and there is a new summer menu.

We are always excited at the prospect of eating at Liberty, but the last few times have been disappointing. This time was no exception and it will be our last visit. From the apathetic servers to the bar that doesn't know how to make basic  mixed drinks and the inconsistent results on food, it's just not up to par. Our calamari fries were good tonight but our "adult" grilled cheese had unmelted slices of cheese and missing cheeses and ingredients promised by our server. It's a shame that a great looking place with some talent in the kitchen can't pull it all together better than this.

I've been to the Liberty a total of three times:  The first was during restaurant week- the highlight of my meal was a dessert that was a gooey chocolatey cake with a chocolate stout shooter...but its not on their regular menu and that makes me sad.   The second I went for the Mac N Cheese - which was meh to say the least. I ended up exchanging it because I didn't care for it, dry, over-herbed which was strange because it almost was bland.   Today I went with some coworkers and had the lunch special. For about $8.50 you get the chicken burger with bacon, lettuce, tomato, pickle herbed aioli- more mayo textured, pimento cheese served on a delicious bun. This is served with fries, "dessert", and soda/Iced Tea. Great deal!    The  burger itself was pretty good although I'm not sure I would be back based on that alone. The fries were really good (fresh cut and herby) but when I asked for a side of ranch (don't judge) it was watery blue cheese- ick, and since I'm not a ketchup girl I wished there was a thinner aioli or something just for those...then they would be perfection!   The dessert was a mean joke- basically they were like a Little Debbie-esque snack pecan pie with wrapping left on. I was really disappointed and wish they just made a fresh cookie or just left it out all together.   This would have earned 3 stars but our service was terrible.   Aloof describes our waiter perfectly well. Drinks were left unfilled, he couldn't bother to crack a smile, and he put our checks in the middle of the table (hey we all got the same thing you could have just passed it around to us politely). We had one to-go order which was the special and a salad - this took longer than all of the other meals, even though that was ordered at the same time- she was leaving early so that was definitely a problem...he also failed to mention that he added 20% gratuity- which at $1.70 a piece wasn't a big deal but it's always a bit sketch when they don't say it outright. It seemed like he knew he was getting gratuity added so he didn't bother to be friendly....so -1 star based on service alone.

Awesome spot for a late breakfast/brunch. Food was fresh- avocado toast and fried green tomatoes were to die for. My boyfriend had the chicken blt and said it was one of the best he's had and we're from jersey!! - I highly recommend this place!

This place had a sign out front advertizing the best burger in Charlotte.  I would not go there, but it was very good.  Only problem was that the brioche was falling apart so it was hard to eat.  I also ordered the peas and carrots, which were excellent.  Overall very good, and they had live music the night I was there.  Literally at the end of their parking lot is the East/West train station, so it's very convenient to commuters from north and south.

I stopped here for lunch since I had passed it many times and finally decided to try something new. The reviews weren't bad and after standing in the parking lot deciding between this place and the place across the way I decided on The Liberty. The lunch menu is pretty small, but preferable to sprawling menus that guarantee they specialize in nothing. I decided to order a bacon cheeseburger (their Pub Burger) with fries and their tomato bisque as an appetizer. After sitting for a while my burger shows up without having ever gotten the soup. I asked the waitress to remove the soup from my order since it never came. She was very apologetic and offered the soup for free if I still wanted it. I declined since my food was already here and there just wasn't really a point in still wanting an appetizer. As I looked at the food I immediately noticed this is one of those places that serves those tall impossible to eat burgers. I really have no idea how most people feel about this, but personally I kind of hate when I'm served food that's overly and unnecessarily difficult to eat. I've never met a human that can open their mouth wide enough to take a decent bite of a burger this tall. I couldn't fit the burger in my mouth and after taking a few bites of nothing but bun or lettuce I frustratingly scraped off much of the toppings just so I could actually take a bite. I had ordered my burger medium and after my first bite saw that it was cooked all the way through. No pink at all, not medium. This is nit-picking, but for a place that proudly hangs a giant banner stating "best burgers in Charlotte" you'd expect them to have mastered the art of correctly cooking a burger, at least. After the waitress apologizing for the soup so strongly I decided not to even mention that my burger was cooked incorrectly. Another reason I didn't complain about it being cooked incorrectly is that the flavors were there. The food WAS tasty and I enjoyed my burger despite it being deconstructed since it didn't fit in my mouth. The burger was juicy and covered in condiment and soft grilled onions that spilled/squirted from the back of the burger as I took a bite, flooding my hands with mayo and grease and bits of grilled onion. I'm just not big on eating food that makes me feel like I need to take a shower when I'm done eating.   While the food did taste good and the service was good I removed stars for the forgotten appetizer, unwieldy and difficult to eat construction of the food, and not cooking the food to order (why even ask me how I want it, then?). Even though this place has good things going for it I kind of regret coming here and won't return. Your mileage may vary.

We received a Groupon as a gift so we decided to stop by for lunch to redeem it. We made a reservation on OpenTable and were promptly seated upon arrival. Then we sat for about 10 minutes before anyone came over to bring us water or ask if we'd like anything to drink. The bartender and came over and apologized for the delay in service. Maybe they were understaffed? I ordered a Dr. Pepper and it took longer to get that than a beer. You'd think they'd be able to pour it in the bar area - instead the bartender had to go to the opposite side of the restaurant. Despite the slow service, everyone we encountered was friendly!  If you're dining with picky eaters, this place has a lot of variety - burgers, sandwiches and salads. Overall, I thought the food was average. The poutine was the best part of our meal. I ordered a burger and a side salad and my boyfriend ordered the hot chicken and sweet potato fries. The burger was fine - no issues. My boyfriend said the hot chicken was good but for those of you who have had Nashville hot chicken - it's not the same. It looked like there was some sort of sauce on it rather than the typical hot breading.

The Liberty is a great spot to hang out for some good food and a decent beer selection. I've been here a number of times and never had a bad meal. On Tuesdays they have unlimited poutine - it's fantastic. In the bar area buy an order and get unlimited refills as long as you're there - worth coming in for.

I've never really been driven to want to visit Liberty but I finally made it in on the beckoning of a friend. It's not a bad place at all and I would absolutely go back to try a few more menu items.  The menu is lengthy but not overwhelming in quantity of choices. Rather, the choices are all very unique. Don't stop on the front as there's twice as much once you flip it over including all the entrees. There are lots of burgers and sandwiches. Also plenty of starters and small plates. We ordered the pretzels with beer cheese as our starter. We weren't especially impressed with it. If you want pretzels and beer cheese go to Heist. I was disappointed with the low number of salad options too. Would've been nice to see some obvious protein options to go with them.  My girlfriend ordered the pecan crusted trout - a mainstay around here it seems. But they do it right. On a pile of mashed potatoes with green beans that were delicious. The unusual item included in this dish was a peach chutney that didn't actually come out on the plate - it had been forgotten. I got the fish tacos and the amount of fish in them was too small. Still, the flavor was on-point! Would've been nice to have three instead of two and a smaller portion of fries. Which, by the way, was a huge portion of parmesan dusted fries with herbs. I actually didn't realize it came with fries. I'm not sure if that was on the menu. And I wasn't in the fry mood so I paid the extra $2 for a different side - smoked tomato grits. Exceptional! They look like mac and cheese but aren't that cheesy. Lastly, my friend got the fish and chips (another pile of parmesan fries) and said it was fantastic.  Our service was very nice and attentive. It was mostly empty inside though - Wednesday evening isn't apparently a popping time for them. Prices are a bit on the high side - $15 for fish and chips, $19 for the pecan crusted trout, and $10 for my fish tacos which I felt to be lacking for that. The walls and booths are all lined with repurposed pallets and supports made of repurposed beer kegs with lights inside to set the ambiance. All in all though in many ways it feels like a chain restaurant/bar. I hope to make it back in some day to try out some more stuff. Otherwise, I would recommend them to anyone in the meantime.

My wife and I live in the South End neighborhood and are going to visit The Liberty often!  They have a fantastic bar and some great food.  We initially went to sample "Charlotte's Best Burger".  I vow to update this review but based on this visit, it's a 3 star.  The burger was a great burger but was honestly far from the best.  I still would stand by the Charlotte classics at Diamond, Meullers... even newer spots like Jack Beagle's in NoDa.  A big beefy messy burger doesn't always equate to a great burger.  We will definitely return though and will update with new finds.  Update:  I have been back twice now and I have to switch to a 4 star.  The quality is just so good that I can't help it!  I had the Pub burger again and it was great, but still not the greatest in my opinion.  I have since had their Poutine Fries, more Pretzels, and tried the Caramel Salted Boudine and all was fantastic.  The fries were incredible because the gravy was not heavy, yet extremely flavorful... and the cheese was great quality and was nice and gooey through the whole dish.  The fries didn't get soggy in the dish either.  Highly recommend it!   On the menu it sounds quite unhealthy but it's just fancy cheese fries and it's a must try!  Will agree with the crowd that the service is a little bit lacking.

I just do not know if there are words to describe the love I have for the "Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich" at The Liberty. Couldn't decide between breakfast or lunch on Sunday at noon, but the country ham won out. The Ultimate Breakfast Sandwich has 2 eggs, bacon, country ham, cheddar cheese, tomato jam, tomato, arugula, and aioli. I think. But since thats not a long enough list of ingredients, I added a side of pimento cheese. I'm wild. I wish it didn't come with breakfast potatoes because there were a couple of sides I wanted to try, I bet I can swap out next time. As in next weekend because ill be back for that sandwich. For $10 including the side it was a hell of a deal.  Boyfriend got the famous "Crunch Burger" He really enjoyed it. How could you not love a giant burger with homemade chips, pimento cheese and bacon though? His mac and cheese was really creamy, but overall pretty bland. Have to try the fries next time!   We also started with the fried pickles, which were breaded and cooked perfectly. Love that they come with hot sauce. Because I love to drench anything and everything in hot sauce.   They have a great little patio area. Perfect for brunching.   4 stars because our service was lacking. Had to ask for silverware when our meals came out -- didnt have for the appetizer and could have used some more water refills. Not a huge deal, but would have made the experience perfect.

The Liberty has an amazing atmosphere. Unfortunately it is at that point you should turn around and leave, because the experience will often only get worse.  On our latest visit, several opted for a high-top table in the bar, where we watched one server clean a table - three times - and multiple servers pile dirty plates onto another table. Maybe the kitchen had no room for dirty plates. Yet for some reason they didn't want to speak to us, as clearing tables seemed to take a priority. It could have been us, and that is okay, but it doesn't speak highly about their service.  After we were asked about drinks - and we did place an appetizer order - we eventually received the drinks, which ran dry before we ever saw someone again, and the food never did come out. Since the appetizer order was ignored and the drinks were never refilled, we opted to ask for the check and leave.  Just another disappointment at The Liberty.
The quality of the burgers and fries were really poor. The burger was small and overcooked and pricy. Sorry, will not be back.

Service was really great but the food and atmosphere ... not so much. My husband and I went to eat there for dinner Saturday night. My first disappointment came when they told me it was restaurant week and my only option was to order a 3 course meal. I just wanted a normal entree but they didn't allow that. So I ordered the calamari fries, pimento crusted filet, and cheesecake. The calamari fries were heavily breaded which is fine but then drenched in sauce so it was served soggy YUCK! Then the one ounce filet tasted like old meat and the pimento cheese was just poured on top, not "crusted." Then the cheesecake had a strange consistency and tasted like filling from inside a donut. They promote the place as a gastropub but I felt like I was stuck in a big open warehouse with bright lights and no decor.
Cool place, great food (best turkey burger I've ever had), and reasonable prices.  I'll definitely be a regular.

Just went here for my birthday with some friends.  The food was pretty good! The vibe is really good, too! The poutine was good though a little cold when we got it. The pretzels were amazing, and the cheddar grits were okay.  Everyone liked their entrees at the very least, some loved theirs.  We had a lot of problems with the drinks, no drink menu, weak drinks, gross drinks. Ultimately most of us ended up going with beer and wine. They were really good about swapping things out, so I think they were still ironing out some kinks.  We will try it again though and see if there is an improvement.  One thing we did think was odd is that the waitress was asked to bring out cake for everyone to sing. Not that I'm a big fan, as I get embarrassed, but such is tradition. The waitress came out and put the cake down in front of me saying "sorry we don't have any candles or we would have sang", and walked away. Maybe she was shy, AND I'm sure there was a way to get someone to come over and start the table singing.  We did it on our own though, thankfully, since we have such fun friends!

Best burger I've found so far in Charlotte and the place just looks cool.  I ordered the Southern Prime Crunch Burger.  There are homemade chips on the burger thus the "crunch". I'll definitely be back there to try some more burgers and have that one again.

Everyone has a bad night and Saturday nights can be unpredictable. As a result, I thought of not writing anything because maybe it was just an off night. Unfortunately, one or two bad missteps turned into a catastrophic fall down a flight of stairs and the Life Alert was out of reach.    45 minutes late to be seated for a reservation was a poor start.  Reservation: noun: an arrangement whereby something, especially a seat or room, is booked or reserved for a particular person.  plural noun: reservations  "do you have a reservation?"  synonyms: booking, ordering, securing  "the reservation of the room"  I think there was a Seinfeld episode involving a reservation???  We were sat at 3 separate tables instead of one which made conversation non-existent. Other tables opened BUT we weren't sat there for some reason). Another 30 minutes to get our order taken (drinks arrived sporadically). Dinner showed about 15 minutes later, which was good. Nothing like being hangry for a late dinner turned even later.   Again - everyone has a bad night so 1 star above the worst rating and a shot a redemption in the future.  There's no way this place could be this terrible all the time...or can it?

It's been a while since I'd been to the Liberty. Years, in fact - back when they were co-awarded "best burger in Charlotte." I never had a bad experience, but this place just fell out of my regular rotation of lunch spots.  Once I heard about their poutine, which is a new addition to the menu since I'd last been, I had to check it out again. I ordered the Carnitas Papas Fritas Poutine and it blew my mind. Plenty of fries, curds, and gravy, but topped with a mound of tender pulled pork, fresh and creamy goat cheese dollops, scallions, and cilantro. It was absolutely delicious...so much so that I vocalized an obscenity describing how good it was while sitting by myself at the bar eating lunch. The bartender thought maybe something was wrong, but it was actually just that good that I had to say a four-letter word aloud. The Carnitas Poutine  is a meal in itself, and at only $9, it's a good deal too.  I haven't had their traditional poutine yet, but they offer it bottomless after 5:00 on Tuesdays and I'm sure it's delicious as well. The rest of the menu looks even better than when I'd been there before, including a French Dip Burger that I'm excited to give a try to in the near future. So, the Liberty will be making its way back into my SouthEnd lunch lineup after this experience. Good stuff!

An absolutely adequate food and beverage venue. They deliver what they advertise-- bar food. They have fantastic drinks and craft beer. A solid place to go with an impromptu party of 9. They were courteous and kind. Definitely a great place to visit. Consistency is key--and they've got it. (However, always order your meat one temperature above your actual wishes.)

Really enjoyed our meal here-I would have returned before we left town but there wasn't time. The calamari fries were really, really good. I have never had a preparation like that before and I really enjoyed them. The cheese plate was good. They should give you more bread because there really is not enough with the generous portions of cheese. The waitress brought us more but it took awhile to come.   I then had a salad and my friend the fish and chips. I am not so into beer so I had a cider-if you are into beer I would definitely check out the selection. I think we had dessert but I was so full I cannot remember what we had.  Our server was pretty on it until the end.

I've been curious about The Liberty for some time now, and I finally made it in to try some tasty lunch!  I went into this meal with no expectations - I just wanted to give it a try. Hubs and I grabbed a seat on the patio, which was just lovely for half of the time, the other half I was covering my ears due to the fire engines leaving the station across the street. No matter though - that's not Liberty's fault!  Liberty is pretty neat inside - a great bar area with plenty of high tops and a main dining room with lots of low, amber-colored lighting and a big kitchen in the rear. I also meandered downstairs where there is a really cool private dining area. Super sweet.   Anywho, back to my experience. Our server was really sweet and efficient, especially considering we were the only people eating on the patio. I ordered the chicken & dumplings and was quite happy with the bird - crispy skin, plump bird and a small smattering of carrots, mushrooms and a few greens. While I was expecting large dumpling (considering the dumplings part in the description) it came with seven or eight ricotta gnocchi. Now, I love me a gnocchi, and these were indeed delicious, it just wasn't what I was expecting.   The star of the meal though was my husband's mac 'n cheese - I totally took over that little skillet. It's the baked mac with more cheesy goodness than I ever though possible. Delicious, creamy and topped with a light coating of breadcrumbs. I don't know what types of magical cheese were in this tasty skillet, but I couldn't help myself.   Overall, a really solid dining experience at The Liberty. I look forward to coming back, especially since it's in my 'hood!

This place has the best veggie burger in town. Best I've ever had frankly!   The sauces are so delicious & the fries it comes with are crispy and yummy. Halfway thru eating my burger I found myself wishing I had another one (I'm that fat). But in actuality, the burger will definitely having coming back for more.

Good food, good staff, nice atmosphere. There is some awesome parking in the back. A big space downstairs for groups. They have a nice beer selection. Absolutely worth checking out for a solid dining experience.

We came for a dinner with great friends and had a wonderful time.   First make a reservation if Thursday-Sunday. They book quick and the wait can be daunting if you don't. The bar is cool to wait at though if you need to. You can eat there too.

The food came out fast but some could have stayed in the kitchen and saved me some disappointment.  The onions on the wedge salad did not work.  Also the fried calamari was soggy.  I went for lunch one and it was way better.  I will not be doing dinner here again.

I LOVE Charlotte Restaurant Week! It is one of my favorite times a year. I mean who doesn't love to dine at some of Charlotte's best places for $30? My prior experiences at The Liberty made me decide to make this my Restaurant Week stop and to invite some friends to join. Two of my friends had never been to the establishment so I was excited for them to try it.  Now, I understand that restaurants can be a little more hectic during Restaurant Week and it seems the goal is to seat as many guests as possible. I completely understand this from a business point of view. However, I have eaten at other Charlotte establishments during Restaurant Week and had a very nice meal and not felt rushed. My friends and myself have enjoyed two hour long dinners with 4-5 courses during previous Restaurant Weeks and that has led to it being one of the things I look forward to.  I have never had a problem at The Liberty but I was very disappointed in the service we received during our last visit. My main problem with the service was our courses came too close together. So close that while we were enjoying our second course the third course was brought out while we all still had about half of the entree on the plate. We had a reservation, we were on time for our reservation and when we left we were the last table on our half of the restaurant. Why such a rush? I hate that such poor service has tarnished my opinion of The Liberty. I love to support local establishments and I believe that The Liberty is a positive asset to South End.   I can't write a review and not mention the food. The food was quite delicious. We were all in agreement on that. I had the pig ear pad Thai, chicken and waffles and the apple bacon pie. The pad Thai was amazing! I could have had that for two courses. The "chicken" and waffles was an interesting take on the dish. The chicken was described as "nuggets" but I would classify it closer to a croquette. The gastrique was devine. The apple bacon pie was great, but was disappointed that you couldn't taste the bacon. Three out of four of us got that for dessert and we all agreed it could have had more of a bacon flavor. The fourth member of our party ordered the fried Mars bar - that should be a menu staple! Amazing!  While our overall experience was good, the most disappointing thing of all is that two new patrons to the establishment had this experience and I am doubtful they will return. Charlotte Restaurant Week is a great way to try a new establishment and I am disappointed that my friends were not able to experience The Liberty like I have in the past.

Confidence (n): full trust; belief in the powers, trustworthiness, or reliability of a person or thing.  Best burger in Charlotte - that's a pretty confident statement right there. Being a burger aficionado, and seeing a self-proclaimed "best of statement", just meant I had to check it out.  My first encounter was during Queen's Feast 2011, so it was a prix fixe menu (and was incredible, I might add.  Quail and waffles? Heck yes!). But my second visit was for the holy grail: the burger.  First impressions are key, and the layout and mood established by the Liberty was iffy for me at first, but it grew on me.  After I adjusted to the back-lit walls of beer images (and the golden amber glow they exuded), I was okay.  I do enjoy the beer theme they have going (and the visibly well-used tap room with many great choices on draft).  I've never had a bad server at The Liberty, which is another plus.  On this bovine feeding frenzy, we started with poutine for an appetizer.  I'd never had this Canadian staple before, so I have no idea how The Liberty's stacks up, but it was pretty amazing.  Fries and gravy - what could be better.  Adam got the beef burger and I got the lamb burger (so we could swap bites, naturally).  They arrived with just the right amount of pink in the center and both were rich in flavor and melted in your mouth.  I have a really hard time trying to decide which burger was better...might have to return for a tie breaker. The fries that accompany do the burger justice.  My only complaint with my lamb burger would be the bun.  I know that the meat should be the showcase of the burger, but if the bun is too frail (and gets soggy and disintegrates),  it makes for very messy eating. Beef up the bun a bit and we'll be in business; I don't mind doing it, but eating a burger with a fork just feels wrong.  Final analysis: go to The Liberty and order a burger.  Don't ask questions, just do it. You're welcome.

Food was OK.  Waitress was hustling,  Waited 1 hour to get food.  Excuse was they were not expecting this many people at lunch.  Will never go back again.  Management at Liberty needs to get their act together.
Not so good. Cold pretzels, that they forgot to bring. I liked the green beans but they are buttered not blackened. Turkey burger was raw.

What The Liberty lacks in service, it makes up for in food.  You must go to this restaurant with that in mind.  I have dined at The Liberty I would say around 10 times for both lunch and dinner.  I am dying to try brunch---duck confit omelette, are you JOKING??  The devils on horseback appetizer are phenomenal.  The crispy bacon wrapped around sugary sweet dates stuffed with salty blue cheese are a match made in heaven.    I also enjoy their take on mussels, Angry Mussels if you will.  The broth is guzzle-worthy, but if you need extra bread for dipping (which I have never NOT required) it will be an extra $1 for 3 pieces.    The lamb burger, which I snagged a couple bites of, is good enough to convert any non-lamb lover into a lamb loving lunatic.    On the downside, the service is slow, and not charmingly so.  Go for the food, but maybe eat a snack first!

I wanted to like this place since it is close to home.. however the food was terrible.  We just went for a quick dinner, sat at the bar and order the Pig Chips and something they tried to pass off as Poutine.  The chips were ok - my husband ate them, however the poutine was disgusting.  Not sure why they wanted to put an egg on it and never saw anything that resembled cheese curds.    I hope they improve, but it will be a while before we're back.

I made it! I have been driving past and heard so much about the Liberty for two years now, and I finally made it in for lunch the other day.  This place strictly sells burgers - so you had to be in the mood to eat one.  But they have quite a variety of burgers to eat which is nice, from vegetarian to egg to meat on meat.  The atmosphere is very laid back, chill and fun to be in.  Great beer selection as well.

What a great restaurant! We have lived in Charlotte for 4 years and just now discovering this gem! We ordered something that wasn't on the menu anymore and they accommodated and made it for us!! Great food and great service!!

We stopped in for a late lunch after hiking. It wasn't very busy, and because we were dressed so casually we chose to sit at the bar.  My friend and I ordered mimosas and the Cobb salad - I asked for no bacon and dressing on the side and the order came out right.  It was okay. Nothing was wrong, it was just a functional meal and non-remarkable. Our bartender was a our server and he did an okay job too.  The ladies room was not very clean which is an issue for me. It was after the lunch rush so should have had some attention.  I probably wouldn't make this a destination, but it's close to home for me and sometimes you need a place to pop into that's predictable.

Our experience was not what you would call great.  I believe the server forgot our table existed.  Our food came out really fast and the fries and mac and cheese were warm like they were sitting in the back.  We did not get any silverware and had to go find someone to ask for it.  When our meal was finished , we had to ask someone to clear our table and get the check.  If the food was great , it might have been worth it.   The burger was average and because of the service, I can think of a dozen better burger pubs in Charlotte .

This is the worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant in Charlotte. $78 for three people at lunch on Memorial Day (3 burgers and 3 beers). We waited an hour for our food, had to get our own drinks from the bar, and although our friends sitting behind us arrived shortly after we did, they still didn't receive their order when we left. Truly a lack of managerial decisiveness and poor employee training (our server didn't know that Stella is a beer). This second visit will be be the last for us.
I'm giving a 5***** review for one reason:  Poutine.  If you're French Canadian, Liberty is the spot for one of the best comfort foods ever.  Cheese curds, braised beef cheek and porcini gravy.

This place is all things great!! Went there for brunch on Sunday no wait staff was very pleasant and knowledgable of the menu. The salmon over mushrooms and peas was awesome! The steak and eggs cooked to perfection!! We will be back for more

My mom and dad were in town on Sunday afternoon. After great internal debate of what Charlotte-area restaurant would best suit them for lunch, I decided on The Liberty. It was a solid choice.  We got there around 12:30, and I figured we'd end up having to sit in the bar area since the dining room was full-up. But the pint-sized Asian hostess was able to immediately fit us into a booth/seat along the central amber-glowing beer wall.  Our waitress, Kristin may have been her name, a proud and tall curly-haired brunette with a slight caramel tint to her pale skin, greeted us forthright with brunch menus, and welcomed us with a sincere smile. In my opinion, The Liberty and Brazwell's Pub on Montford are in stiff competition for maintaining the most attractive wait staffs in Charlotte. As I glanced around the dining room, I struggled to identify which of the tight-black-clad waitresses exceeded the others in form and virtue. I couldn't rank them; they're all just flawless.  My mother, admiring the pallet-wood walls, barrel-keg columns, and frothy-yellow suds inlaid the back-lit wall behind her, turned to me and said, "So... this is basically a bar? A pub?"  I laughed. "Yes, um... it's a restaurant. And a bar. All restaurants are bars these days. Charlotte has evolved into a drinking city of late. We have like nine breweries and a hundred new restaurants. It's a foodie town now."  I checked out the brunch menu. I didn't even realize The Liberty had brunch. Apparently that's a new ubiquitous Charlotte dining offering as well. I browsed the options under the brunch heading - typical fair: omelettes, shrimp and grits, steak and eggs, etc. But for me, The Liberty is a burger joint. It'd be silly to deviate from what they do best. I was, however, particularly moved by the listing in the bottom left corner of the menu - Bottomless Mimosas for $12. Not something I could really do with the folks, but I'd be back for those.  "I'm getting a beer," I said. "You guys want beer?"  My mother declined, but my dad was into it. "I want something dark," he said.  I scanned the beer list - lagers, pale ales, double IPAs, Guinness (eh, maybe), a couple ambers, some of the traditional OMB and Triple C options, but nothing particularly dark. I wanted to order a local beer, but none was quite fitting. Kristin returned, "You guys know what you're drinking?"  "We need something dark-ish. How dark is this Imperial Stout?"  She kind of wavered. "It's... good," she said. "Maybe not that dark, though."  My dad was easily sold. I went for a Triple C Light Rail Pale Ale, which I stuttered out in awkward tongue-twister form. Eh, she knew what I meant.  The beers came quickly. I sampled my father's Imperial Stout; it was, indeed, good - kind of rich and earthy with a sharp after-taste. I'm never disappointed by a pale ale, so I found my Light Rail satisfying - just enough hop to give it a flinch, but easy enough to match most any meal. I tried to get my mother to order a beer or a glass of wine, but she declined. She explained that beer had never suited her. She also later explained that marijuana didn't suit her either; it would cause her to get light-headed and faint. I found that hilarious and adorable; it's amazing the things you learn about your parents in adulthood that you would never be privy to as a child.  We ordered: my dad went with the brisket burger; mom got the signature Liberty Pub Burger. I decided to go rogue and try the fish n' chips. Kristin scribbled it all down, nodded, smiled, fetched our menus, and spun away.  My mom cleared her throat. "So, honey..." she began, "I was reading your Yelp reviews..." "Oh, dear..."  "Those ones from Philadelphia... I was reading them with your sister..." "Oh, dear..." She paused to choose her next words. "We were trying to decide if you're embellishing these things, or if you really drink that much..." I laughed. "Everything that happened is one-hundred percent true. I only embellish the language; everything situational is real."  She nodded. "Well, if that's the case... I don't think we like this Huxley very much."  I laughed again. "Well, ya know, we've had a weird relationship. I don't really understand why she is the way she is, but I try to give people the benefit of the doubt."  "I don't think you should see her anymore," my mother asserted.  I nodded. "Yeah, that's probably not even really up to me..." From there, the conversation steered elsewhere. Kristin returned in short time with our entrees. My folks were impressed; I was too. My dad methodically destroyed his brisket burger; my mother only managed half of her Pub burger, but that was a lot for her. I melted over my fish and chips, so much beer batter... so much malt vinegar. And we all salivated mindlessly over the crispy, seasony fries.  At the end, my dad and I argued briefly over the check, before I relented. He is, after all, my elder.  "Are you going to Yelp about this one?" my mom asked me.  "Yes, mother. I am."

Love it-lots of fun IPA's and a cool  arty decor consisting of beer kegs, beer art, and delivery skids. Lots of seating, booths too-however make reservations.   We had the poutine- excellent, the famous Southern Living 2012 pick-the Crunch burger- delicious- shout out for the cole slaw-yummo and the truffle fries.   Unfortunately they share the parking lot with Tupelo Honey and it was brunch time so parking was a pain. Dress is casual and they have outdoor tables too.

OMG,  stay away.  I've anticipated their opening for weeks now.  And actually waited a few weeks so they could work out the kinks.         To start. The service was non existent and the weren't even busy.    Once the manager was made aware of our lack of service and care.  He was less than concerned and not even apologetic.   To top it all off,  I got the Fish & Chips and was sick from food poison I presume alll night.   Such a bad evening and following day

I was very skeptical when I saw that The Liberty's burger was voted best in Charlotte for 2011. I mean, how can you get better than Big Daddy's? Well, I totally agree with their selection!  The Liberty's burger is amazing - cooked just the way you like it (medium rare for me), served on a soft, brioche bun, generously topped with cheddar cheese, thick, crispy bacon, condiments, and a fantastic aioli sauce. I have to tell you, I hate mayo on my burgers. But this aioli is dynamite!  The burger is served with their signature fries. They were ok, but I should have swapped them for their pimento mac 'n cheese, since I am such a mac 'n cheese nut.  So, why only three stars? The service could have been more attentive, and two of our three the appetizers (blue cheese chips, devils on horseback) were not very exciting. My husband enjoyed the chicken and dumplings, but the dish was too salty and I was not impressed that their "dumplings" are actually gnocchi. Ho hum - have had it better elsewhere!  Even so, I will return to The Liberty for the burger!

I love home made soft pretzels, had them at southend location so tonite we decide to order it at new location . Taste still amazing with cheese sauce .  New drinks menu have been improve  Don't forget to try Pear martini !!!

Here is another gem... my first visit to Charlotte did not disappoint, I was a little unsure at first but all was great !  Arugula salad was delicious, but for 9 bucks should have more beets! Mussels were outstanding - soooo good.  I had a nice flight of 4 beers- great selection of local brews.  Thanks to another review - I am having dessert- Salted Caramel Budino - wow!
The burger and beer reputation this place has lived up to the hype.  One of the best burgers I've ever had and discovered dogfishhead hellhound double ipa that I've never heard of.

I'll be honest. The food was 4.5/5 stars. The angus short ribs were great. And the sliders with kimchi were sublime. And I'd also like to add that the nice person who waited on our table was super. I didn't get her name but I'm sure people think she's great. She had her nose pierced btw.   That said, the reason this place only gets a "A-OK" from me is because one lady who was there left a really bad impression on all of us. Yes, we did say it was a party of 6 but ended up being 8. Luckily, it wasn't like the place was so full they couldn't do anything about it. But one employee, who wasn't wearing all black so she might have even been the hall manager, decided to give us a little pep talk with a stern tone. "Next time, make sure you guys tell us how many because..." Probably said something like 'difficult' or something. Anyway, what's the big deal? I'd completely understand if it were totally packed and we were rubbing against one another... with other groups. It wasn't. And maybe it was her way of not meeting eyes or none existent smile. Bottom line, we loved the food and our waitress, but had one negative factor bring down the overall evaluation. I'd still go back later though.   The food was good. Oh, yeah, their tequila shots were good too. That should get a couple of you guys heading over this weekend. Haha.
Great Short Ribs!  Will definitely go back to try other entres.  Plan to drink beer, the wine list is weak.

I don't even know how to begin this review.  Everything from the food to the private dinning room was really good.  So I'm just going to list out everything that was awesome.  1. Shrimp n Grits.  Best I've tasted since moving to Charlotte.  Man, folks really do love their shrimp n grits in the Carolinas!!  It's like BBQ in Tx.  On almost every menu!!    2.  Fried Pickles.  Read my review from Fran's filling station http://www.yelp.com/biz/frans-filling-station-charlotte#hrid:RrnwPLvSWBC5ZW4_mhHPEw and you will see how much I heart fried pickles.  These were just as delicious.  yum  3. Service was awesome.  Everyone was so nice!  4.  Mac n cheese?  Yes please....  5.  Private dinning room is spacious and will accomodate a well sized wedding party.   Great experience.  I want to try their brunch because I hear that's just as good if not better.  I'll be back, Liberty....just you wait.  I'll be back.

Like others I saw the sign outside about the "best burgers in Charlotte". But when I saw the house smoked brisket sandwich I could only imagine how much better that would be.  In reality it was the worst brisket I have ever had.  It was as tough as beef jerky.  I didn't want to complain in front of my guest so I just called and asked to speak to a manager and explained the situation. I got a simple apology and no offer for a refund. After I had to ask about it she took my info so someone could call back.   Note to owners Matt and Tom. If there isn't anyone working the joint with that kind of authority or customer service then how in the world would you expect consistent quality food or service.

The next time I'm craving a burger...give me The Liberty or give me nothing. Well, they do have great burgers. I went here with my daughter and grandson for lunch after hearing great things from friends. We started with the soft pretzels. Let me say right now, I have been eating soft pretzels for a big portion of my life and these salty, soft beauties with cups of sharp cheddar cheese dipping sauce have set a new standard with me. The pretzels alone are probably worth making the trip. My daughter got the "famous" crunch burger and after eating a quarter of it myself, I have to say that it is maybe the best burger in Charlotte. I had the BBQ sandwich which came with a huge mound of sweet smokey pulled pork and cole slaw on a soft brioche bun. French fries were OK but nothing to write home about. My Grandson's french toast was a masterpiece of flavors and textures, sweet syrup over crispy and soft french toast , salty bacon with whipped cream on top. Service was good, parking can be a hassle during busy times, but for a burger this good....I'll wait for a parking place.

Got food poisoning here in December, probably from a salad with bacon (like strips, not pieces) that was bizarrely ice cold, with beef on it that was, somehow, also ice cold. My husband, who ordered a hamburger (that was fine, according to him), did not get food poisoning, and we shared a plate of poutine (that was somehow ALSO cold). Tables are insubstantial and service was slow, but polite.   I had been waiting for this location to open for what seemed like forever, and was happy to finally go there. Will never go back, and was sure to warn everyone at the urgent care and in subsequent doctor visits that they should stay away as well. Really unfortunate.

Great first visit! Service was friendly and attentive. The food is delicious. Great selection and can't beat the price. Started with the smoked wings and had the pulled Posey sandwich. Not over sauced and big chunks of meat. Glad this place is so close to our house we will be coming back. Have family visiting from out of town and will definitely bring them here.

I came here on a Saturday afternoon for a quick bite and a drink.  The service was good and the food/drinks came out quickly.  I was seated and greeted right away.  I like the restaurant and it's atmosphere.    I was pleased with my food, I only had an appetizer and a drink, so nothing big.  The drink was tasty and well made.  I have not been here for an actual meal, so will definitely update when that happens, but overall I was satisfied with my visit and didn't encounter any issues.

Based on my earlier review you'd be right to question my sanity in going back to The Liberty.  I don't really know what prompted the second visit, but I've now been back to try the famous burger...  And, to my surprise, it was really good.  So, my second visit to The Liberty was on a Sunday night.  I met my mom there, and the place was nearly empty.  This led to our getting good service from a young woman who was not only attentive but pleasant.  Having remembered that the wedge salad was the one redeeming part of the first meal I had at The Liberty, I ordered a wedge salad for us to split.  It was good - though we weren't offered small plates on which to split the salad.  Not a big deal, but it would have made the process of sharing the salad much easier.    We both ordered the pub burgers for our entrees.  Our burgers were cooked to the requested temperatures, and the fries were fresh and really tasty.  This was a total departure from my last visit when the fries were inedible.  The brioche bun does have a bit of difficulty holding up to the size of the burger and the quantity of the toppings (veggies) that come on it.  Nonetheless, the bun is tasty and it breaking apart at the end wasn't really a problem for me.  (I expect burgers to be a bit messy.)    While I enjoyed the meal, I'd certainly argue that the food is overpriced.  The burgers are $13, and pints of beer are $5 and up.  We had two burgers, the salad, two glasses of house wine and two pints of beer and the bill was $64 plus tip.  That's just too much for what we got, but, then again, that's Charlotte if you are close to Uptown.    I enjoyed the burger enough to go back, but I think Big Daddy's (er... "Bad Daddy's") is not only a better deal with food of comparable quality but also a place with more "burger" options.

Knew it'd be rough cobbling a vegetarian meal together here, but it turned out to be even more challenging that I expected. Ancient Farro, a side, was the most satisfying part of my meal - colorful, forest-floor-y, earthy. I also dipped everything I could get my hands on in the spicy mustard served with the (super buttery) pretzel, although I don't think it was house-made. Because we had to order tons of sides to get everyone full, we ended up spending twice as much as our meat-eating pals, which was great.   Beer selection was good, with most of the exotics on the bottled list. I always tend towards tap drawn cervezas so I gave a couple of newbies a try. The high grav beer flight was terrific, and a steal at 6 bucks. Service ranged from spacey (door girls) to efficient (our waiter). If the Cheesecake Factory was masquerading as a Gastropub, decor-wise, it would look like this.  A piece of advice for the Liberty's Chef de Cuisine and anyone else out there building menus, yet scared to put options for us "hippies" on there: We like good food and beer too. All it takes is a couple of options to get us in the door. A lot of vegetarian peeps are food-saavy - we're going to spend money at your place, if you make us feel welcome. And I'm not talking about a roast vegetable sandwich, a la 1982. I'm talking about real, well designed, prep-heavy Entrees, on par with the rest of the menu. Tofu isn't just for stir-fry. Tempeh isn't hard to find. There are umpteen-million veg food bloggers out there you can rip off, if you're lacking inspiration. It ain't hard. Once you've taken the plunge to vegetarian-ville, veganifying an option or two is even easier - just keep margarine around to prep with, make cheese optional, and you're set.   Shit, I'll consult for free. Call me.

The liberty has the potential to be great but it is marred by inconsistent food and service. First time I went - lamb burger was fantastic, so juicy and well arranged w other flavors. Service on point. Second time for brunch- service awful; could not get waitress' attention. Short rib entree solid but not spectacular. Third time - service good but burger and fries cold; fries tasted old like they had been sitting somewhere for a while and Pub Burger lacked oomph of similar burgers I've had elsewhere. In sum, go w low expectations and you might be delighted.

Perfection! Thursday night dinner here was so nice. I had the pecan crusted trout, which was cooked to perfection and had various fruit toppings that added moisture as well as flavor. It came with mashed potatoes and green beans. There weren't many pecans, so don't count on the influence of the texture or sweetness of pecans. My date had the shrimp appetizer and mac & cheese big bite. The appetizer portions are not large enough for a meal, which our lovely waitress, Angela, forewarned. Based on how quickly he ate, these appetizers were good.     The service was excellent. While it wasn't a busy night, we were seated right away. The food took about 10 minutes to come out, if that long. Angela was informative and personable. The bonus was the live music, which we were directly in front if. This can go terribly wrong when the music is too loud. However, the volume was appropriate for the venue and crowd. Overall, this was an excellent experience and I recommend The Liberty for a low key dinner date.

Was starving, originally wanted Tupelo Honey but after getting there the wait was an hour and we were absolutely famished.  Popped across the parking lot, no wait, fast friendly service, good food. Had the poutine - yummy, fattening, good.  Biscuits were very good, as were the truffle fries.  Would return.

I was happy to book a thanksgiving reservation for my friends and I when I saw the three course dinner that they were offering. That third course, was a dessert bar!    First of all, I've been to The Liberty on numerous occasions and they have an awesome lamb burger. The location is in the lovely South End are of Charlotte and the interior decor is nice and chic, with a lovely dining area and separate bar area.  Ok, now, let's get to the food!  First Course: My guests and I enjoyed delicious pumpkin gnocchi, rock shrimp salad, and lobster and crab cakes. I particularly loved the sauce on the pumpkin gnocchi (my first time having pumpkin!) and the vinaigrette on the crispy rock shrimp salad.  Second Course: Prime rib with creamed spinach casserole and mashed potatoes with a mushroom gravy...yum! The pork was also delicious with smoked Gouda mac and cheese, bacon wrapped ham and sweet apple compote. Wow! It was the only dish that really looked like typical Thanksgiving fare, but it was definitely superb.  Third Course: Dessert!!! I was wary, since I am allergic to eggs, and it's rare that a restaurant has a dessert that I can actually eat. To my surprise, they had plenty for me to enjoy! I had the berry cobbler and apple crisp...amazing! They also had an assortment of chocolate cake, cookies, bread pudding with marshmallows, cheese cake with strawberry sauce, lemon meringue tarts, and a few other things that I can't quite name, since I've never tried them. Just know, there was a smorgasbord of sweets on that table!  It was an overall delightful experience and completely stress free, with no clean up! Yay! The service was wonderful and the owner even stopped by. He was very friendly and personable. I'd recommend The Liberty to anyone. If you're ever in Charlotte, please stop by. They have amazing burgers, salads, and a yummy, popular, fresh pretzel appetizer. Thanks The Liberty!

Apparently the Liberty is the place to be...who knew?! The ambiance is great and casual. Sat at the bar for a late lunch on Saturday. I had the blackberyy, whiskey cocktail, thing...i cant remember the exact name because it was good and strong. :) i had a cobb salad that was delicious and fries on the side. They were good too. All around. Great location with delicious cocktails and yummy food.

The pecan crusted trout with peach relish was everything. And the sweet tea was close to perfect. Like that perfect space that is just sweet enough and not too sweet.  The fish was to die for and I could eat the relish out of a jar. (Wait, do y'all sell that? If so, I'll pick some up on my next visit the Charlotte). A girlfriend ordered the Mac and cheese, which was a little too cheesy for my taste, but overall we enjoyed everything.

We went here on a recent date night because my fella loves burgers and they advertise that they were voted the best burger in Charlotte. We were seated quickly at a table that had booth seating on one side and chairs on the other. The chairs were so uncomfortable that we both sat on the booth side, which is something we never (and I mean NEVER) do.   We ordered drinks, which were overpriced (I think $5 for a blue moon bottle) but good. As I scanned the menu, I thought about different options. I first thought about the BBQ shrimp appetizer (listed as a "big bite") but the server informed me that it was one slice of toast with a few shrimp on it (for $13). Nope. Next I considered the fish and chips but the server told me it was not the traditional cod. Nope. I did not want fried tilapia. Feeling like I had no other choice, I went with the crunch burger. My boyfriend ordered the same and we both had Parmesan fries   Our food came out very fast. We both agreed that it was a decent burger, but definitely not the best in Charlotte.
